lorebooks.creator: 89Alex89

1.content:
World Name: Midgard ‚Äì The World of the Life Stream.
Genre: Medieval Fantasy, Steampunk, anime, sword and sorcery.
Lore and Description: In Midgard, a world of magic and technology, the Life Stream flows through everything ‚Äì rivers, winds, forests, mountains, and every living creature. It connects life, magic, and nature into a vast, invisible network and is the source of all life.
All over the world, there are ancient discs, relics of times long past. They contain the essences of creatures that are now considered extinct. Some once fought alongside heroes during the Great Mana War, which nearly destroyed this world, while others were corrupted by evil. The discs lie hidden in ruins, caves, lakes, or deep in the forests. No one knows exactly what power still lies dormant within them.
In the heart of the world stands the Mana Tree. Its roots reach deep into the earth, while its crown touches the clouds. According to legend, it is the source of the power that nourishes all life. Under its shade rests the sword Calendir, once wielded by a hero in the great Mana War. No one has ever seen the tree or the sword, but their stories are passed down from generation to generation.
The landscape of Midgard is full of life and secrets. Cities surrounded by settlements are home to the hustle and bustle of humans and other peoples. Agricultural villages meet cities where steam-powered technology in all shapes and sizes can be marveled at, while airships glide through the clouds. In the deep forests, elves live in harmony with nature, while in the more dangerous regions, all kinds of beasts and monsters lurk. Majestic mountains rise into the sky, inhabited by dwarves or crisscrossed by ruins of long-forgotten civilizations. Clear, sparkling lakes and rivers refract the light, and sometimes a glimmer of the life stream can be seen in their waters. It is said that the water itself is home to a fish-like people who watch over it. Between the valleys and plateaus lie ruined cities and temples, whose walls preserve ancient relics, runes, and secrets. Above it all, islands float in the sky, some connected to the earth by chains, others floating freely, home to the bird-people known as the Orni. Far away, at the edge of the world, endless ice and sand deserts stretch out.
Midgard is a world full of mysteries, legends, and adventure. Dragons soar through the clouds, the life stream pulsates in everything, and somewhere the discs, the mana tree, and the sword await to be rediscovered by brave adventurers.

2.content:
Magic in the World of Midgard:
Description: The magic of Midgard originates from the life stream that permeates everything and feeds mana. Mana is the essence that is woven, directed, and manipulated by users. Magic is not only felt, but actively shaped: it can heal wounds, strengthen the body and senses, bring light into darkness, or lift curses. At the same time, it can be corrupted and used for dark, destructive magic, which is why its use is strictly regulated in many places.
Not everyone can use magic. It requires skill, practice, and understanding to safely channel mana. Some beings are naturally receptive, while others learn through intensive training, practice, and mentoring. Spells can be cast through words, gestures, runes, symbols, artifacts, or pure willpower. Precision and concentration are crucial, as mistakes can cause 
unpredictable damage. The use of magic is strictly regulated in many places. After the Great Mana War, which plunged large parts of Midgard into chaos centuries ago, rules and controls were introduced. Only certified practitioners are allowed to use magic openly in cities and during large rituals; unauthorized use can result in severe penalties. This ensures the stability of empires, cities, and villages, while protecting the life stream.

Elements of magic:
Wind, water, fire, earth ‚Äì pure elemental magic, controls natural forces and physical phenomena.

Subcategories of magic:
White/Holy Magic ‚Äì healing, cleansing, protective; serves life and order.
Dark/Unholy Magic ‚Äì cursing, destructive, manipulative; feeds on corrupt mana.
Gray/Chaos Magic ‚Äì neutral, drawn directly from the source of the life stream; neither light nor dark.

3.content:
Content Type: A few Legends and myths of Midgard.
Description: The ancient tales of Midgard are steeped in countless legends of heroes, dragons, magical artifacts, and mysterious places. It is said that a young man from the borderlands was once chosen by fate to gather a group of companions and fight against the forces of evil that plunged Midgard into the Great Mana War. No one knows what the hero looked like, only that his deeds were courageous and marked by unparalleled willpower. It is said that his sword called him to the legendary Mana Tree in the Mana Forest, and only a heart of the purest intent could wield its blade. After evil was defeated, the hero is said to have returned the sword to its place in the forest; his own fate and that of his companions remains a mystery, but statues were erected in some cities in honor of these heroes‚Äîsilent witnesses to their deeds, faceless so that only their sacrifice and not their names would be glorified.
The stories also tell of a tree whose existence has hardly ever been confirmed ‚Äì the Mana Tree, an ancient source of the stream of life, without which all life on Midgard would dry up. Surrounded by the mysterious Mana Forest, whose mist and clearings are described in old fairy tales as being alive, lies the legendary sword that can only be wielded in times of greatest need by a person with a pure heart. No one knows whether the tree and the sword really exist, but the stories keep them alive, passed down in songs, legends, and the tales of the elders.
No less mysterious are the so-called seal discs. After the Great Mana War, many animals and powerful creatures, now considered extinct, did not simply disappear, but turned into round, brown stone discs about the size of a plate and several centimeters thick when they died. Each disc bears a mysterious image that preserves the essence of the sealed being. Fields of such discs have been discovered, some resting on root-like offshoots that dig deep into the earth, even in places of great battles. Adventurers report fleeting images on the discs, but no one knows how ‚Äì or if ‚Äì the creatures resting within can ever be released.
And then there are the dragons. Ancient myths speak of Auralyth, whose scales are said to have been as white as snow, a being of wisdom and kindness who taught humans. Quite different was Veyrathor, whose scales were jet black, corrupt to the core and bound to the dark forces, sealed by heroes in the Great Mana War so that his wings could never touch the sky again. Kaelthyr, the storm walker, was neutral, directing the wind and only intervening when his realm was threatened. Pyrrakos, the fire demon, is said to have turned all life to ash with his breath, while other dragons such as Morwinstead, the rock dragon, or nameless creatures exist only in fragments of stories. And only sparse legends remain about Aetherion, the emperor or god dragon: half bird, half dragon, with white and golden feathers, ally of the hero whose fate was lost in the mists of time.
Finally, there are tales of the Black Fortress, a mighty fortress that rose from the earth and created the floating islands, relics of the ancient landmass. The fortress was powered by four elemental cores‚Äîfire, earth, water, and wind‚Äîthat had once been stolen from temples. They were guarded by the evil magician until the hero destroyed them and returned the cores, but then disappeared without a trace. Some claim that the shattered remains of the fortress still lie deep in the sea and that its power is a warning to those who dare to meddle with it.
Thus, myths, legends, and traditions interweave in Midgard to form a web of ancient stories. Whether they are true or just fairy tales remains hidden in the mists of time ‚Äì but they teach, warn, and inspire those who roam the world.

4.content:
Name of the country: Etherium
Description of the country: Etherium lies in the heart of Midgard and is a land of great diversity: mountains, forests, rivers, lakes, villages, and towns characterize the landscape. Snow-capped mountains lie to the north, rolling hills to the south, forested ridges with dangerous creatures to the west, and coastlines and tall forests to the east.
The capital, Dravendral, is the center of trade, magic, and technology, with an airship port and the castle of the royal family of Aelthar. The neighboring Principality of Valdoria supplies the cities with agricultural products, while other cities and villages populate the countryside.
Etherium's forests, mountains, and mysterious places are home to elves, dwarves, fish people, and monsters, as well as ancient ruins, streams, and waterfalls. On the east coast lies the port city of Korvalis, and above the world float the Sky Islands. Dragons soar through the skies‚Äîa land full of nature, magic, technology, trade, and adventure.

5.content:
Location Name: Dravendral
Location Type: Capital City
Description: Dravendral lies in a valley surrounded by waterfalls and rivers, directly connected to both a sea port and an airship dock. At its center resides the royal family Aelthar. The city serves as the economic and cultural heart of Etherium, shaped by craftsmanship, magic, and technology. Workshops like the forges Fireblade and Hammer & Anvil, the carpentry shops Woodflow Workshop and Emerald Oak, and clockmakers like Gear & Time produce goods for all races. Magical workshops such as Runestar, Arcanum, and Crystal Cauldron provide enchanted items, while markets like Grain & Goblet and Sunpepper sell food and exotic goods. Shipyards like Blue Wave and Steelbow build vessels for the waterways, while airship yards Skyglider and Windsail Works craft airships. Taverns such as The Golden Anchor, Flying Dragon, and Silverspring offer rest and social exchange, and specialty shops like Crystal Grove, Healing Leaf, and Star Compass provide rare and unique items.
Dravendral unites trade, craftsmanship, magic, and technology in a vibrant city where all races of Etherium live together.

6.content:
Location Name: Principality of Valdoria
Location Type: Principality
Description: Between the capital city of Dravendral and the northern and western regions lies the Principality of Valdoria, a fertile land full of rolling hills, soft meadows, and vast fields. The landscape is crisscrossed by small rivers and streams that collect in ponds and lakes. The fields of Lorthen and the orchards of Marvalis provide food for the villages and towns, while the pastures of Brenholt support livestock farming. Dense forests such as the Eldranthain and the silvery Farweth preserve ancient paths whose history is told in the ruins of small stone circles and abandoned hunting lodges.
Numerous villages inhabited by humans, dwarves, and other inhabitants lie in the valleys and hills. The settlement of Branthorpe lies on a riverbank and lives from fishing and small mills. Ravencourt, hidden in a forest valley, is known for its craftsmen and lumberjacks. Hollowfen, located on the edge of a small moor, combines agriculture with fish farming. Wyndelbridge lies at a river mouth and serves as a trading hub between the villages and the capital. Eldranford, nestled between rolling hills, is home to fruit growers and blacksmiths. Garrinfall, near a small waterfall, attracts travelers in search of stories and local goods. Faylindale lies on a small hill surrounded by meadows and pastures swept by a steady wind. Finally, Morwinstead nestles against the edge of a forest, its inhabitants living from forestry and hunting. The Principality of Valdoria looks like a green ribbon between the capital and the more distant mountains and forests. The gentle landscape is characterized by fields, rivers, lakes, streams, forests, and small hills that connect the villages. Small waterfalls, such as the Torrilfall or the Feydrinfall, run through the landscape, bringing life and movement to the valleys.

7.content:
Location Name: The surroundings of Dravendral
Description: The land surrounding Dravendral and the Principality of Valdoria forms a diverse and living landscape that frames the capital with natural beauty. The wide Hyrndral River winds through the Valley of Eryndral, fed by tributaries such as the Syrdel Stream, Kelbrin, and Tornval. Rolling hills and depressions hold lakes like Arvelis, Silver Lake of Neryth, and the dark Mondfen. Valleys such as Meylan, Thyros, and Velmorn are interspersed with oak groves, pastures, and farmland, while dense forests including Thalmyr, Aeloras, Sylvat, Morgrath, and Calveth cover much of the terrain. In the north, the Kaelthar Peaks rise, feeding waterfalls like Lumerin Falls and streams such as Durmloch, Irrendal, and Brynnfall. Settlements dot the hills and plains, from small villages like Tavryn, Kelbraith, and Myrdral to market towns such as Orrendale and Fenndralis. The landscape includes rolling plateaus like Beryth, rugged cliffs of Greyrock Ridge, fertile plains of Auren Field, and hidden caves including Kovarn Grotto, Crystal Cave of Velthros, and the Gorge of Dramor. Mountains, rivers, forests, valleys, plains, lakes, and mysterious places combine to form a living, ever-changing surrounding area that embraces the capital and the principality like a protective shield.

8.content:
Villages of the Land of Etherium:

Location Name: Tavryn.
Location Type: Agricultural Village.
Region: Surrounding Area of Dravendral.
Description: Tavryn lies on a gentle hill in the valley of Eryndral, surrounded by wide fields and green meadows. A small stream winds its way through the village, supplying mills and fields with water and creating a peaceful, lively atmosphere. The thatched houses are grouped around a central square where merchants sell fruit, vegetables, and handicrafts. On the outskirts of the village are orchards and small pastures that supply the village itself. Children play on the hills while farmers tend their cows and sheep. Tavryn seems like a quiet but productive spot that supplies the surrounding towns with food. Old paths lead on to neighboring villages, where travelers are rare but welcome.


Location Name: Kelbraith.
Location Type: Forest and craft village.
Region: Surrounding area of Dravendral.
Description: Kelbraith nestles on the edge of Sylvat Grove, a dense and ancient forest full of oak and spruce trees. The inhabitants live from logging, forestry, and handicrafts such as pottery, carpentry, and basket weaving. Narrow paths wind between the wooden houses and workshops, while warehouses store the finished goods. At the edge of the forest are small clearings where cattle graze or grain is grown. Children help with the work and learn the old paths and secrets of the forest. Kelbraith is watched over by an old watchtower that monitors the forest and protects the village from intruders. In the evening, the scent of wood and fresh bread fills the air, creating a cozy atmosphere.


Location Name: Myrdral.
Location Type: Craftsmen's and blacksmiths' village.
Region: Surrounding area of Dravendral.
Description: Myrdral lies at the foot of the Graunfels Heights, between rolling hills, small streams, and fields. Here, blacksmiths, woodcutters, and carpenters have their workshops where they make tools, furniture, and ironware. The straw- and tile-roofed houses are grouped along paths that lead to the fields and pastures. Children help with chopping wood or working in the fields while the adults run their workshops. The village is known for the quality of its craftsmanship and supplies goods to the surrounding villages and towns. On the outskirts of Myrdral, there are small orchards, herb gardens, and meadows that provide additional sustenance for the village. Small bridges span the streams that flow through the village, creating idyllic places for conversation and trade.


Location Name: Orrendale
Location Type: Market Town
Region: Surrounding area of Dravendral
Description: Orrendale stretches along the southern bank of the Hyrndral River and is a fortified town that regulates trade between the villages and the capital. Food, fabrics, and handcrafted goods are sold in the central market square. Mills and workshops are located in the side streets, while small inns offer lodging to travelers. The city walls protect against raids, and watchtowers guard the river. Merchants from distant regions gather in Orrendale, creating a bustling, lively atmosphere. Barges moor on the riverbank, transporting goods and supplying the village with fish and other foodstuffs. Small gardens between the houses provide fresh fruit and herbs that enrich the daily lives of the inhabitants.


Location Name: Fenndralis
Location Type: Fishing village
Region: Surrounding area of Dravendral
Description: Fenndralis lies on the eastern shore of Lake Arvelis, surrounded by rolling hills and meadows. Fishing boats line the shore, and the inhabitants fish and farm small plots of land in the surrounding fields. Wooden and stone houses line narrow paths that connect the lakeside trail. Early in the morning, fishermen head out to sea, while merchants trade goods on the shore and welcome travelers. Small mills and warehouses complete the infrastructure, and children play on the shore between the boats. The village is lively but peaceful, a place where tradition and daily work are closely intertwined. Old stones on the lake shore tell stories of generations long past and create a mysterious atmosphere.



Location Name: Branthorpe
Location Type: Fishing village
Region: Principality of Valdoria
Description: Branthorpe lies directly on the banks of a quiet river fed by the surrounding hills. The village lives mainly from fishing and operates small mills for processing grain. The houses are built of stone and wood, many with thatched roofs. Orchard and small vegetable fields stretch out around the edge of the village. Children pull their nets from the wooden walkways along the riverbank while traders from the surrounding villages collect fresh fish. In the evening, the lights from the houses are reflected on the water's surface, creating a peaceful, lively scene. Old stones on the riverbank tell of long-ago floods and the legends of the fishermen.


Location Name: Ravencourt
Location Type: Craftsmen's village
Region: Principality of Valdoria
Description: Ravencourt is hidden in a valley between dense forests rich in oak and fir trees. The village is known for its blacksmiths, woodcarvers, and carpenters. Between the workshops, the houses stand close together, built of dark wood with narrow windows. Small paths wind through the village, while the surrounding forests provide wood and game. Tools, supplies, and finished goods are stored in the old warehouses. On certain holidays, fires are lit in the village square and merchants from other regions offer their wares for sale. In Ravencourt, stories are told about the ancient forests and hidden ruins in the nearby hills.


Location Name: Hollowfen
Location Type: Farming and fishing village
Region: Principality of Valdoria
Description: Hollowfen lies on the edge of a small moor, whose waters surround the village. The inhabitants farm the surrounding fields and fish in the moor's canals. Small wooden bridges connect the houses across the waterways. Herbs, vegetables, and fruit trees grow in the gardens. Farmers herd their cows and sheep across the wide meadows, while fishermen set out in their boats early in the morning. At the edge of the village, old, half-ruined barns rise up, telling tales of past generations. The village is known for its handmade baskets, nets, and tools made of reeds and wood.


Location Name: Wyndelbridge
Location Type: Trading village
Region: Principality of Valdoria
Description: Wyndelbridge lies at the mouth of a tributary of the Hyrndral River and serves as a central hub between the villages and the capital. Jetties and small bridges connect the houses across the water, and goods are transported on barges. Merchants offer everything from food and tools to fabrics from distant regions. The village population lives from trade, small workshops, and fishing. Away from the main street are orchards and pastures that provide the village with food. The sound of the workshops mixes with the voices of the merchants, creating a bustling atmosphere. Old stones on the riverbank are reminders of past floods and legendary festivals of the ancestors.


Location Name: Eldranford
Location Type: Fruit-growing and crafts village
Region: Principality of Valdoria
Description: Eldranford lies in a gentle valley between hills and meadows. The village is famous for its orchards, especially apples and pears, as well as for its blacksmiths and carpenters. Half-timbered houses line the streets, often with colorful shutters and flower boxes. Small paths lead to the surrounding fields and forests. The villagers gather in the village squares to hold markets or exchange news. Animals graze in the pastures while children wade through the streams of the valley. Above the hills, you can sometimes hear the hammering of blacksmiths and the rustling of the forests.


Location Name: Garrinfall
Location Type: Village by a waterfall
Region: Principality of Valdoria
Description: Garrinfall is located near a small waterfall that flows into a clear pond. The inhabitants live from agriculture, fishing, and using the water for mills. Wooden and stone houses stand along narrow paths that circle the waterfall. The waterfall creates a constant murmur that echoes through the village and creates a soothing atmosphere. Herbs and flowers bloom between the houses, while cows and sheep graze in the surrounding meadows. Travelers and merchants often pass through Garrinfall on their way to larger cities. Ancient ruins nearby tell of times long past.


Location Name: Faylindale
Location Type: Hill Village
Region: Principality of Valdoria
Description: Faylindale stretches out on a gentle hill, surrounded by wide meadows and fields. The houses are made of light-colored stone, often with thatched roofs, and are scattered along the paths that lead through the fields. The inhabitants raise livestock and grow crops, while craftsmen have small workshops in their homes. Wildflowers and herbs bloom in the meadows, and a light breeze blows across the fields. Children play on the slopes while adults tend to animals or work in the fields. The village is quiet but lively and offers views of the surrounding valleys.


Location Name: Morwinstead
Location Type: Forest and hunting village
Region: Principality of Valdoria
Description: Morwinstead lies on the edge of a dense forest that protects the village from the gaze of outsiders. The inhabitants live from hunting, forestry, and small fields laid out in clearings. Wooden and stone houses blend harmoniously into the surroundings. Paths wind between the trees, which are home to animals and wild plants. Tools are made from wood and stone in the workshops. In autumn, the leaves turn golden and the village is visited by wandering hunters and travelers. Ancient legends about the forest and its creatures are passed down from generation to generation.

9.content:
Location Name: The Borderlands of Etherium.
Location Type: All locations that are part of the borderlands.
Description: The Borderlands form the outer line of Etherium, a vast, rugged terrain full of untamed nature and hidden dangers. Each race has its territory here to protect the empire:
The dwarves stand guard in the high mountains, in fortresses such as Darkspire Keep or Blackfang Hold, from where they watch over the cliffs, passes, and valleys. They control rivers such as Hraldir, Veyndral, and Fennbrook, which are fed by icy glacial lakes, and patrol waterfalls such as Blackfall or Frostveil, where monsters occasionally settle.
In the flatter plains and hills stand human outposts. Small settlements such as Brackenholt serve as bases for patrols to secure roads and fields. Trade routes and small rivers connecting the capital and the principality are also protected here.
The fish people guard the water borders. They inhabit rivers, lakes, and estuaries such as Lake Arvelis or the Silver Lake of Neryth, control the waterways, and warn of unwelcome intruders.
The elves guard the forests. In areas such as Draemwold, Thornveil, and Grimwood, rangers patrol ancient paths, secure the treetops and trails, and protect the animals and plants from outside threats. In the dry, open lands such as the Sarenna Wastes and Beryth Plains, barbarian tribes roam the plains. They know every valley and oasis, hunting and watching over these border regions, whose vastness harbors unpredictable dangers.
The borderlands are a living network of mountains, rivers, lakes, forests, and plains, populated by guardians of every race. Ancient ruins, hidden caves such as Gloomhollow or the Cavern of Whispering Stones, and ancient watchtowers remind us that this is a land of vigilance, danger, and protection‚Äîa living wall surrounding the Etherium.

lorebooks.name: kuuga stuff
lorebooks.website_description:
A remaster of my Kamen Rider Kuuga Lorebook, because the old one didn't line with how I make ones now, along with the fact that there's so many parts that don't get properly detailed due to little info on the Kamen Rider Wiki and official website.

To combat this, I made my own descriptions based on what's shown in the show, on the wiki and a little from the website to make what you'll see in here.
lorebooks.description:
How to transform into Kuuga:

1. Place your hands flat on your waist to summon the Arcle, while also using your will to choose which form, indicated by the colour of the Amadam (Red for Mighty, Blue for Dragon, Green for Pegasus and Purple for Titan).

2. Retract your right arm along with moving the left arm to the right then swiftly move your right arm to the left diagonally with a two-fingered gesture on the hands.

3. Shout "Henshin!" while simultaneously moving the right arm to the right diagonally and moving the left arm across the Arcle until it is perfectly at the left of the Arcle.

4. Swing the right hand to the left and press the Activation Button.
lorebooks.creator: Cflame06

1.content:
Rider Name: Kuuga

Motif: Stag Beetle

Rider Type: Melee (Range in Pegasus and Rising Pegasus Form)

In ancient times, a peaceful tribe known as the Rinto was terrorised by the monstrous Gurongi, who engaged in a deadly game, known as the Gegel, killing for power. To combat this menace, the Rinto created a warrior endowed with the power of Kuuga, who succeeded in defeating the Gurongi and sealing their leader within a cave.

Transforming with the power of the Arcle, Kuuga accesses a variety of different forms for different situations, unlocking and upgrading them as they hone their skill. Changing their armour shape and colour, Kuuga's standard forms are the balanced Mighty Form, the agile Dragon Form, the precise Pegasus Form, and the strong Titan Form. Eventually, they upgrade them into stronger Rising versions, even pushing Rising Mighty into the black Amazing Mighty, before accessing their final form, Ultimate Form. Conversely, when weakened or inexperienced in terms of power, they are forced into the ineffective Growing Form.

When Kuuga is severely injured (for instance, they're stabbed with a harpoon), they'll revert to their Growing Form before turning back to their normal form 10 seconds later.

UNLOCKING FORMS: When Kuuga starts off (by putting on the Arcle and starting their transformation by punching and kicking the enemy, causing the biological suit to form), they'll have Growing Form as the default, but when the Amadam within Kuuga's Arcle senses their will to fight seriously with their might to protect others (for instance, wanting to protect everyone's smiles to stop the Gurongi making people cry or die in fear), they unlock their Mighty Form, making that the default. The Amadam picks this up in their mind, and if they continue to cower or only fight for themself, they'd be stuck to only having Growing Form until they learn how to fight seriously. This way of unlocking their form is the same for all of the base forms (Dragon Form by sensing their will to jump higher, Pegasus by sensing their will to see their foe at great distances and Titan by sensing their will to have greater defence and strength, or learn how to fight a foe by walking up to them and attacking them up close). For the Rising Forms, Kuuga has to get the Amadam in their Arcle imbued with electricity, which would give them the ability to access the upgraded forms of the base forms, and to unlock Amazing Mighty Form and Ultimate Form, they have to get another and greater surge of energy into the Amadam. Each time Kuuga unlocks the base forms, they have to figure out how they work for them to use them, which means unlocking the form doesn't instantly give them knowledge on how to use it, and they have to figure it out themself or by deciphering Rinto Hieroglyphics related to that form.

When Kuuga is severely injured, they'll revert to their Growing Form before turning back to their normal form 10 seconds later.

When using Kuuga's Ultimate Form, only those with a pure heart could control it (which is indicated if the eyes are red); otherwise, they'd quickly lose control and become a monster, bent on destruction (which is indicated if the eyes are black).

Kuuga's armour is made up of their body, which has changed completely, as the Arcle changed their atomic structure when they transform, which can be reversed if they change back. 


---

Form Name: Mighty Form

Form belongs to: Kuuga

Amadam Colour: Red

Mighty Form (also known as Unidentified Life Form No.4, or simply UFL No.4 or No.4 by the public) is Kuuga's red main form. It is the most balanced out of all of his standard forms, and is thus his most used form. Unlike his other forms, it has no personal weapon, instead opting for hand-to-hand combat.

In this form, Kuuga uses the "Mighty Kick", a long-running kick which leaves his mark on his target, causing them to explode. However, if the target's resistance is strong enough, the Kuuga mark will fade away, cancelling its explosion.

Mighty Form's Appearance:

HEAD:

Head Shell: The smooth, black exoskeleton-like structure of Kuuga's head, which is the most sturdy part of the body. It protects the brain from all impacts.

Warrior's Crosshorn: Kuuga's golden crosshorn, located at the front of Kuuga's head, which has two prominent horns on each side of the head that are slightly over the eyes, a smaller one at the centre and a piece that goes down the face until it touches the top of the Stag Mouth. It also has a red orb at the centre.

Stag Eyes: The slightly large compound insect-like eyes of Kuuga. In Mighty Form, it is red and gives Kuuga eyesight 10x stronger than that of a normal human.

Warrior's gold: The golden trim that goes around the bottom of Kuuga's helmet, which goes a bit over the mouthpiece and connects to the bottom of the Warrior's Eyes. It also contains barely noticeable Rinto hieroglyphics written across it.

Stag Mouth: The metal mouthpiece of Kuuga's head, which has small structures on it which give it a look like an insect's mandibles. It also has a metal chinstrap that protects the jaw and holds the main body of the Stag Mouth.

Warrior's Ear: The black, slightly curved diamond-shaped pieces at each side of Kuuga's head. In Mighty Form, it gives Kuuga hearing 10x stronger than that of a normal human.

BODY:

Bio skin: The black armoured skin that covers the entire body. It has both supple elasticity and diamond-like hardness.

Mighty Chestplate: Kuuga's chestplate in Mighty Form. It has a similar structure to the Growing Chestplate from Growing Form, especially the six-pack-esque structure at the front, but it is red in colour and is stronger in terms of defence, but not as strong as the Titan Chestplate. At the bottom, it contains Rinto hieroglyphics written across it.

Warrior's gold: The golden structure on the top of Kuuga's chestpiece, both seen in his Growing and Mighty Form. It also contains Rinto hieroglyphics written across it

Mighty Paudrons: Kuuga's shoulder pauldrons in Mighty Form. It has a similar structure to the Growing Pauldrons, but just like the Mighty Chestplate, they're red and are stronger in terms of defence, but not as strong as the Titan Chestplate.

Forearm Guard: The forearm wraps that cover Kuuga's forearms. They have a golden trim at the top and are red in Mighty Form.

Ancient Bracers: The golden bracelets on Kuuga's wrists. In Mighty Form, the small orbs on the left and right of the bracelets are red.

Warrior's hands: The black glove-like hands of Kuuga, with square-like segments at the back of the fingers. It also has a hand pad at the back of the hands, which is red in Mighty Form.

Knee Protector: The golden kneeguards of Kuuga's legs. In Mighty Form, the large diagonal oval-shaped orb in the centre is red.

Ancient Ankler: The golden ankle braces on Kuuga's Ankles. In Mighty Form, the small orbs on the left and right of the bracelets are red, which can glow a different colour if Kuuga unlocks another form.

Warrior's feet: The black foot armour of Kuuga's feet. The soles have a Rinto hieroglyph that'll be shown when Kuuga performs the Mighty Kick.

2.content:
The Arcle (also nicknamed as Kuuga's belt, or simply the Mysterious Belt) is an ancient belt created by the Rinto Tribe. It is capable of strengthening its wearer and creating a biological armour for them to use in combat, but is only usable to those with a righteous heart to prevent abuse of the belt's power. 

It was forged over a millennium ago, with an Amadam placed into its centre, to be given to a Rinto Warrior named Riku to become the first Kuuga. When Riku sealed the Gurongi away into the Sarcophagus of Kuuga, he remained dormant for over a thousand years in suspended animation. In the modern day, when the seal was broken, Daguva ripped the Arcle off Riku's waist, killing him, making it inactive until it chose another to pass on the title of Kuuga in the modern day.

When the wielder transforms, it reappears around their waist and is always the same colour as their current form. At the heart of the Arcle lies the Amadam, a mysterious spirit stone that receives the will of the assimilated creature and gives them the ability to transform into Kuuga.

When the Arcle is equipped for the first time, the Amadam will glow a bright white light, and the belt will diffuse inside the wielder's body via the waist, permanently bonding with their body. The bonding process takes around five seconds to complete and is rather painful, leaving a mark that looks like mild sunburn and could possibly scorch any clothing that is in the way.

The Arcle can technically choose its user if they're close, shown by giving them visions of the Ancient Kuuga, who wielded it last.

It can also give them visions, from telling them how to perform certain moves, how to find a way to unlock Mighty Form (in case it hasn't been unlocked) to warning them about the wielder's Ultimate Form (Dark Eyes Ultimate Form to be exact) if they destroy their target in a fit of uncontrollable rage, whether it is the enemy or not, by showing them a menacing illusion of that form doing the same thing. 

However, it doesn't tell them how to use their forms, let alone tell them how to get the other base forms (Dragon, Pegasus and Titan), so they have to figure it out either on their own or by reading Rinto hieroglyphs via a decoder.

The Amadam has different colours which indicate what form Kuuga is in: Dark grey if the Arcle is inactive (only when its not equipped onto the wielder), Orange means they're in Growing Form, Red means they're in Mighty Form, Blue Means they're in Dragon Form, Green means they're in Pegasus Form, Purple means they're in Titan Form, Yellow means they're using one of their Rising forms and Black means they're in Ultimate Form.

When the Arcle begins to form when it is summoned, it'll make a long and powerful energy whooshing sound, before glowing white for a second, making a resounding **TSSHHIERRRRE!!!** energy sound, with the Amadam changing colour into the chosen form.

Once the Arcle has fully formed, it'll begin to make a low-pitched and repeated **VWORP!** sound until the activation button is pressed.

When the wielder begins the transformation by pressing the activation button, it makes certain sounds as the armour forms (transforming into Growing Form sounds like an energy woosh, transforming into Mighty Form sounds like a middle-pitched energy buildup that increases in pitch, transforming into Dragon Form sounds like an energy whistle that increases in pitch, transforming into Pegasus Form sounds like a low-pitched energy heartbeat that increases in pitch, transforming into Titan Form sounds like a barely high-pitched energy buildup sound that increases in pitch) before it ends with the golden crosshorn forming, making a resounding **CLLNG!!!** sound.

Before transformation, the Arcle is diffused within the body at a molecular level, only visible via an X-ray scan, but by the wielder's will, it solidifies and appears at the waist.

By default, the wielder starts off with Kuuga's Growing Form, but as their power gets stronger, they can unlock Mighty Form, Dragon Form, Pegasus Form and Titan Form.

To transform into Kuuga after equipping the Arcle for the first time, the wielder has to land multiple blows to their target, causing each piece to form with each hit with a wavy distortion effect on the area (punching forms the armour on each arm, kicking forms the armour on each leg, and punching the target after these parts form the hard shell, Stag Eyes, Trim and Stag Mouth with an energy whoosh sound, and a final punch forms the armour on the torso along with the Arcle itself) transforming them into Kuuga's Growing Form. This way of transforming into Kuuga stays this way until the wielder unlocks Mighty Form and learns how to do it properly.

To transform into Kuuga, the wielder has to summon the Arcle with their will, usually shown by placing their hands flat on their waist or by drastically spreading their arms out, causing it to solidify and appear on their waist with a wavy distortion effect (which looks like heat distortion), and once it is fully summoned, the Amadam will change in colour to the colour of the form they chose mentally and let out a low repeated hum of power. Then, the wielder proceeds to move their arms to the right slightly before sharply placing the left above the Arcle while the right is facing the left diagonally, and the hand facing upward with a two-finger gesture (Index and middle fingers facing upwards while the ring and pinkie on the palm and the thumb is poking upwards to the side). The wielder then slowly moves the right arm diagonally to the right. At the same time, they move their left arm to be beside the left activation button. They then sharply move their right arm to the activation button on the True Seal and press it down with their right hand, beginning the transformation. As soon as the activation button is pressed, the energy from the Amadam change the wielder's body on a molecular level, causing the biological armour of Kuuga to form one by one with the same wavy distortion effect (which is more of a quick white wave of energy for the bio skin), starting with the bio skin forming over the arms and legs and ends at the feet, followed by the chestplate, then the armour on the arms and legs, including the Ancient Bracers and Ancient Anklers, and ends with the head, with the head shell forming around the head, then the Stag Eyes and golden trim below, soon followed by the Stag Mouth and ending with the golden trim forms below said compound eyes, crosshorn forming last, making a resounding **CLNNG!!!** sound.

To transform into their other forms, Kuuga has to choose them with their will, and when that happens, the Amadam changes colour and then the armour begins to change.

To transform into the Rising Forms (when they're unlocked), Kuuga has to use his will to focus electrical power from the then powered up Amadam across their body, which would cause the Amadam to surge yellow electricity, turn yellow, form the Rising Arcle Armour, and change the armour of their current form to have golden accents, while also upgrading Kuuga's weapons if they're holding any (this works for Kuuga's Amazing Mighty Form too).

To transform into Kuuga's Ultimate Form, the wielder has to summon the Arcle by their will, usually shown by placing their hands flat on their waist or by drastically spreading their arms out, causing it to solidify and appear on their waist with a warp-like effect (with the Rising Arcle Armour already equipped withe Rising Arcle Armour), and once it is fully summoned, the Amadam will change in colour to the colour of the form they chose mentally and let out a low repeated hum of power. Then, they move their arms to the right slightly before sharply placing the left above the Arcle while the right is facing the left diagonally, and the hand facing upward with a two-finger gesture (Index and middle fingers facing upwards while the ring and pinkie on the palm and the thumb poking outwards). The wielder then slowly moves the right arm diagonally, to the right. At the same time, they move their left arm to be beside the left activation button. They then sharply move their right arm to the activation button on the True Seal and press it down with their right hand, beginning the transformation. As soon as the activation button is pressed, a dark aura instantly forms around their body, while golden vein-like lines go across, then the aura forms into the biological armour of Kuuga's Ultimate Form, with the helmet forming last and the crosshorns gaining two extra horns, making a resounding CLNNG!!! sound.

When Kuuga wants to transform back into their normal form, Kuuga has to willfully want to turn back, and when that happens, the armour and the Arcle dissolve back into their body.

User Restriction: The Arcle can only be utilised by individuals with a righteous heart, preventing misuse of its power.

Biological Integration: Once worn, the Arcle integrates with the user's body, enhancing physical capabilities and granting regenerative abilities, making them unable to be killed easily (even if it'd seem that they died, it'd actually be the Amadam putting the wielder in a state of suspended animation (which can be the case for life-threatening damage to keep its wielder alive)). It cannot be removed unless it is forcefully removed via ripping it out of the wielder's body with tremendous force.

ABILITIES: After merging with the Arcle belt powered by its Amadam, the wielder gains a variety of powers: 

Superhuman strength: The Amadam causes his muscles and nerves to always be an a state of strengthening and developing. Focusing this increase in his right leg enables his Mighty Kick.

Longevity: The Amadam gives the wielder biological immortality, meaning they can't die from old age, and mixed with Enhanced Regeneration, they can go without food or water for centuries.

Atomic manipulation (only in Dragon Form, Pegasus Form, Titan Form, Rising Forns and Ultimate Form): When they're in Kuuga's Dragon Form, Pegasus Form and Titan Form, they can pick up an object and change its atomic structure almost instantly, changing it into their weapons in those forms (a rod or pole-like object to form the Dragon Rod, a gun-like object or anything that can shoot projectiles to form the Pegasus Bowgun, or a pole or sword-like object to form the Titan Sword). In Ultimate Form, this ability is so powerful that he could light the molecules in the air on fire.

Enhanced Regeneration: The Arcle belt has spread vein-like connections into the wielder's muscular and nervous systems, causing them to gain a high regenerative ability that far surpasses humans. It is so great that they could heal severe injuries that'd take five months in just three hours. In a case where they sustain a life-threatening injury, the Amadam would put them in a deep coma (which is so deep, it looks more like they died if one checks their pulse either by pressing against their pulse point or measuring it with medical equipment) until the body has fully healed.

Electrical Energy Conduit: If they're shocked with a large amount of electricity, it would instead redirect to the Amadam rather than go through the rest of the wielder's body (and it doesn't matter if it is Direct Current (Current that only passes through one spot) or Alternating Current (current that can transfer all around the body)), which they can surge out at their own will to use their Rising Forms. If shocked with a large amount of current for a second time, it would give them enough power to use their Amazing Mighty Form and Ultimate Form. 

---

The Arcle's components:

The Amadam: A radiant circular spirit stone at the centre of the belt, glowing different colours depending on Kuuga‚Äôs form. It serves as the living spirit stone that channels the host‚Äôs will into power and transformation.

Sealed Shell: A silver-grey metallic casing made of an unknown supermetal, slightly harder than titanium. It protects the Amadam while binding its power to the wearer‚Äôs body.

Glyph Arrays: Two horizontal rows of golden panels inscribed with Rinto hieroglyphs on either side of the Amadam. They maintain harmony between the host and the Amadam, preventing corruption and stabilising transformation. In Ultimate Form, they turn silver with no Rinto hieroglyphics.

Four Aspect Gems: Four small decorative squares in red, blue, green, and purple beneath the glyph arrays. They symbolise Kuuga‚Äôs four sacred aspects‚ÄîStrength (Red for Mighty), Agility (Blue for Dragon), Perception (Green for Pegasus), and Endurance (Purple for Titan)‚Äîthough they serve no mechanical function. In Ultimate Form, they turn gold.

Twin Seals of Power: The engraved side modules bearing the Rinto symbol for ‚ÄúPower.‚Äù The left seal, the True Seal, activates the transformation, while the right seal, the False Seal, serves as a stabiliser.

Circle of Dawn: The circular silver frame surrounding the Amadam. It symbolises rebirth and glows alongside the core during transformation, signifying the warrior‚Äôs emergence.

Rising Arcle Armor: A golden plate that manifests over the Arcle when using the Rising Forms (this also applies to Kuuga's Amazing Mighty and Ultimate Form). It reinforces the belt, stabilising the Amadam‚Äôs overflowing energy while framing the core in radiant gold, symbolizing the peak of Kuuga‚Äôs power and the danger of its excess.

3.content:
The Amadam is a mysterious spirit stone that receives the will of the assimilated creature and transforms their body, as well as giving them its power.

It originally came from a meteorite that crashed down onto Earth over a thousand years ago, and the Gurongi used it to gain their terrifying monster forms, with those in the Go group and Daguva themself the ability to use atomic manipulation to form weapons. 

Once the Rinto were in danger of the Gurongi, they took an Amadam from the meteorite, forged the Arcle and placed the Amadam inside, with said Arcle being given to a warrior to become the first Kuuga.

It is rarely mentioned in the ancient Rinto tribe's inscriptions, and was written like a code, as something to be feared.

If it is inside an Arcle, it can be used to transform into Kuuga's other forms other than Growing Form; otherwise, they can't unlock other forms.

The Amadam can change colour depending on Kuuga's forms (Orange in Growing, Red in Mighty, Blue in Dragon, Green in Pegasus, Purple in Titan, Yellow in Rising and Amazing Mighty and Black in Ultimate). It is a blank dark grey if the Arcle isn't equipped.

In Kuuga's body, something like nerve tissue spreads throughout their body from the Arcle (Amadam) taken into their abdomen, which works on their body to bring about changes and enhancements. It also seems to have a function to control the body with its own judgment, such as eliminating the poison in the body by putting it in a state of suspended animation (which can be the case for life-threatening damage to keep its wielder alive).

It also gives the user the ability to turn objects into weapons by temporarily changing its molecular structure completely.

If imbued with a large current of electricity (like, for instance, a defibrillator), the Amadam could undergo a substrate change and unlock Kuuga's Rising Forms, a temporary power boost to Kuuga's base forms that lasts for at least 30 seconds, though this can be overridden by imbuing it with electricity again.

Later, the Amadam, which received an electric shock, underwent a substrate change and brought about the "power of gold" in response to the wielder's will to fight.

An Amadam is also present in Daguva's body (which gives him access to use his Perfect Form) and in Gouram.

If the Amadam is linked to a similar power source (for instance, Gouram's Amadam), it could prevent the wielder from dying from fatal injuries if their Amadam is broken.

4.content:
Rider Form Name: Growing Form

Form belongs to: Kuuga

Amadam Colour: Orange

Growing Form (also known as Unidentified Lifeform No. 2 or ULF No. 2 by the public) is Kuuga's white, weakest form. Kuuga is forced into this form when he is too inexperienced to access stronger forms or is gravely injured; in the latter case, he will be unable to transform again for 2 hours.

Although his power is weak in this form, he can still use a finisher called the "Growing Kick", though it only has 1/3 the strength of the Mighty Kick.

Growing Form's Appearance:

HEAD:

Head Shell: The smooth, black exoskeleton-like structure of Kuuga's head, which is the most sturdy part of the body. It protects the brain from all impacts.

Warrior's Crosshorn: Kuuga's golden crosshorn, located at the front of Kuuga's head, which has two prominent horns on each side of the head that are slightly over the eyes, a smaller one at the centre and a piece that goes down the face until it touches the top of the Stag Mouth. In Growing Form, the horns are much smaller compared to Kuuga's other forms, which shows the weakness of their Growing Form. It also has an orange orb at the centre.

Stag Eyes: The slightly large compound eyes of Kuuga. In Growing Form, it is orange and gives Kuuga eyesight 10x stronger than that of a normal human.

Warrior's gold: The golden trim that goes around the bottom of Kuuga's helmet, which goes a bit over the mouthpiece and connects to the bottom of the Warrior's Eyes. It also contains barely noticeable Rinto hieroglyphics written across it.

Stag Mouth: The metal mouthpiece of Kuuga's head, which has small structures on it which give it a look like an insect's mandibles. It also has a metal chinstrap that protects the jaw and holds the main body of the Stag Mouth.

Warrior's Ear: The black, slightly curved diamond-shaped pieces at each side of Kuuga's head. In Growing Form, it gives Kuuga hearing 10x stronger than that of a normal human.

BODY:

Bio skin: The black armoured skin that covers the entire body. It has both supple elasticity and diamond-like hardness.

Growing Chestplate: Kuuga's chestplate in Growing Form. It has a similar structure to the Mighty Chestplate from Mighty Form, especially the six-pack-esque structure at the front, but it is white in colour and is weaker in terms of defence. At the bottom, it contains Rinto hieroglyphics written across it.

Warrior's gold: The golden structure on the top of Kuuga's chestpiece, both seen in his Growing and Mighty Form. It also contains Rinto hieroglyphics written across it

Growing Paudrons: Kuuga's shoulder pauldrons in Growing Form. It has a similar structure to the Mighty Pauldrons, but just like the Growing Chestplate, they're white and are weaker in terms of defence.

Forearm Guard: The forearm wraps that cover Kuuga's forearms. They have a golden trim at the top and are white in Growing Form.

Ancient Bracers: The golden bracelets on Kuuga's wrists. In Growing Form, the small orbs on the left and right of the bracelets are orange.

Warrior's hands: The black glove-like hands of Kuuga, with square-like segments at the back of the fingers. It also has a hand pad at the back of the hands, which is white in Growing Form.

Knee Protector: The golden kneeguards of Kuuga's legs. In Growing Form, the large diagonal oval-shaped orb in the centre is white.

Ancient Ankler: The golden ankle braces on Kuuga's Ankles. In Growing Form, the small orbs on the left and right of the bracelets are orange, which can glow red if Kuuga gathers up enough energy to perform the Mighty Kick, even if they're in Growing Form.

Warrior's feet: The black foot armour of Kuuga's feet. The soles have a Rinto hieroglyph that'll be shown when Kuuga performs the Growing Kick.

5.content:
Rider Form Name: Dragon Form

Form belongs to: Kuuga

Primary Colour: Blue

Amadam Colour: Blue

Dragon Form is Kuuga's agile blue form. While it is physically weaker than any of his other forms, it is much faster and can leap incredible heights. Due to most of its abilities being geared mostly to agility, Dragon Form is not ideal for hand-to-hand combat, as it is more ineffective at this than even Growing Form. To make up for its weakness, Dragon Form can transform any pole into the Dragon Rod to use as a staff weapon.

Kuuga's finishing move in this form is the Splash Dragon, an aerial thrust attack to the opponent's torso with the Dragon Rod. This can be in the form of a simple thrust or tossing the Dragon Rod at the target.

Dragon Form's Appearance:

HEAD:

Head Shell: The smooth, black exoskeleton-like structure of Kuuga's head, which is the most sturdy part of the body. It protects the brain from all impacts.

Warrior's Crosshorn: Kuuga's golden crosshorn, located at the front of Kuuga's head, which has two prominent horns on each side of the head that are slightly over the eyes, a smaller one at the centre and a piece that goes down the face until it touches the top of the Stag Mouth. It also has a blue orb at the centre.

Stag Eyes: The slightly large compound eyes of Kuuga. In Dragon Form, it is blue and gives Kuuga eyesight 10x stronger than that of a normal human.

Warrior's gold: The golden trim that goes around the bottom of Kuuga's helmet, which goes a bit over the mouthpiece and connects to the bottom of the Warrior's Eyes. It also contains barely noticeable Rinto hieroglyphics written across it.

Stag Mouth: The metal mouthpiece of Kuuga's head, which has small structures on it which give it a look like an insect's mandibles. It also has a metal chinstrap that protects the jaw and holds the main body of the Stag Mouth.

Warrior's Ear: The black, slightly curved diamond-shaped pieces at each side of Kuuga's head. In Might Form, it gives Kuuga hearing 10x stronger than that of a normal human.

BODY:

Bio skin: The black armoured skin that covers the entire body. It has both supple elasticity and diamond-like hardness.

Dragon Chestplate: Kuuga's chestplate in Dragon Form. It is blue in colour, slimmer and has a slight muscle structure, but not as prominent as the ones for Growing and Mighty Form, which shows that Dragon form is more agile than his other forms. On the sides, it's a slightly lighter blue and has Rinto hieroglyphs writtten on it.

Agile Paudrons: Kuuga's shoulder pauldrons in Dragon Form. It is black and is practically blank and slightly small, which gives Kuuga more movement in the arm joints.

Forearm Guard: The forearm wraps that cover Kuuga's forearms. They have a golden trim at the top and are blue in Dragon Form.

Ancient Bracers: The golden bracelets on Kuuga's wrists. In Dragon Form, the small orbs on the left and right of the bracelets are blue.

Warrior's hands: The black glove-like hands of Kuuga, with square-like segments at the back of the fingers. It also has a hand pad at the back of the hands, which is blue in Dragon Form.

Knee Protector: The golden kneeguards of Kuuga's legs. In Dragon Form, the large, diagonal oval-shaped orb in the centre is blue.

Ancient Ankler: The golden ankle braces on Kuuga's Ankles. In Dragon Form, the small orbs on the left and right of the bracelets are blue, which can glow a different colour if Kuuga unlocks another form.

Warrior's feet: The black foot armour of Kuuga's feet. The soles have a Rinto hieroglyph that'll be shown when Kuuga performs the Mighty Kick.

6.content:
Dragon Rod: To make up for the lack of strength in Dragon Form, Kuuga uses the Dragon Rod staff as his weapon, which is created whenever Kuuga is using any pole or stick-like object to manifest it. His finishing move with the Dragon Rod is known as the Splash Dragon.

Dragon Rod's components:

Power pole: The handle of the Dragon Rod. It is blue and ridged, with golden strips going diagonally on the left and right of the staff. The golden strips contain Linto hieroglyphs written across them.

Extender Pole: The main pole of the Dragon Rod, only extending on each side when Kuuga needs the Dragon Rod to be longer. They also hold the Dragon Energy Points at the end of the pole.

Dragon Energy Point: Circular golden structures at both ends of the Dragon Rod. They also have blue spirit stones at the front and back, with the Linto hieroglyph for "Dragon" written inside. At the end of the Dragon energy point is where the energy of the Dragon Rod comes out when performing the Splash Dragon finisher.

---

Rising Dragon Rod: After Dragon Form is upgraded by the golden power into Rising Dragon, Kuuga gains a golden trim with his weapon being enhanced into the Rising Dragon Rod voulge, giving it the appearance of a twin-ended spear, improving the Dragon Splash finishing move into the Rising Splash Dragon.

Rising Dragon Rod's components:

Power pole: The handle of the Rising Dragon Rod. It is blue and ridged, with golden strips going diagonally on the left and right of the staff. The golden strips contain Linto hieroglyphs written across them. The blue changes to black if it is used by Kuuga's Ultimate Form

Extender Pole: The main pole of the Dragon Rod, only extending on each side when Kuuga needs the Dragon Rod to be longer. They also hold the Dragon Energy Points at the end of the pole.

Dragon Energy Point: Circular golden structures at both ends of the Dragon Rod. They also have blue spirit stones at the front and back, with Linto hieroglyph for "Dragon" written inside.

Dragon's Blade: The two golden blades of the Rising Dragon Rod. They can easily cut through steel.

7.content:
Rider Form Name: Pegasus Form

Form belongs to: Kuuga

Amadam Colour: Emerald Green

Pegasus Form is Kuuga's green sniper form with massively boosted senses, enabling him to see, hit and hear his opponents with extreme precision. However, this increased sensory stimulation overwhelms Kuuga over time, preventing him from using this form for more than 50 seconds without being forced into Growing Form and making him unable to transform again for 2 hours.

Pegasus Form can transform any gun-like object into the Pegasus Bowgun, a powerful crossbow.

With the Pegasus Bowgun, Kuuga performs the "Blast Pegasus", an arrow shot from the Bowgun after pulling the hammer back to the fullest length.

Pegasus Form's Appearance:

HEAD:

Head Shell: The smooth, black exoskeleton-like structure of Kuuga's head, which is the most sturdy part of the body. It protects the brain from all impacts.

Warrior's Crosshorn: Kuuga's golden crosshorn, located at the front of Kuuga's head, which has two prominent horns on each side of the head that are slightly over the eyes, a smaller one at the centre and a piece that goes down the face until it touches the top of the Stag Mouth. It also has a green orb at the centre.

Stag Eyes: The slightly large compound eyes of Kuuga. In Pegasus Form, it is green and gives Kuuga eyesight 1000x stronger than that of a normal human.

Warrior's gold: The golden trim that goes around the bottom of Kuuga's helmet, which goes a bit over the mouthpiece and connects to the bottom of the Stag Eyes. It also contains barely noticeable Rinto hieroglyphics written across it.

Stag Mouth: The metal mouthpiece of Kuuga's head, which has small structures on it which give it a look like an insect's mandibles. It also has a metal chinstrap that protects the jaw and holds the main body of the Stag Mouth.

Warrior's Ear: The black, slightly curved diamond-shaped pieces at each side of Kuuga's head. In Pegasus Form, it gives Kuuga hearing 1000x stronger than that of a normal human.

BODY:

Bio skin: The black armoured skin that covers the entire body. It has both supple elasticity and diamond-like hardness.

Pegasus Chestplate: Kuuga's chestplate in Pegasus Form. It is midnight green in colour and has multiple ridges along it. The light green parts of the neckpiece contain Rinto hieroglyphics written across it.

Agile Paudrons: Kuuga's right shoulder pauldron in Pegasus Form. It is black and is practically blank and slightly small, which gives Kuuga more movement in the arm joints.

Pegasus Pauldron: Kuuga's left shoulder pauldron in Pegasus Form. It is midnight green in colour and has a slightly extended triangle shape, showing it is made with the sniper-like form of Pegasus in mind.

Forearm Guard: The forearm wraps that cover Kuuga's forearms. They have a golden trim at the top and are midnight green in Pegasus Form.

Ancient Bracers: The golden bracelets on Kuuga's wrists. In Pegasus Form, the small orbs on the left and right of the bracelets are green.

Warrior's hands: The black glove-like hands of Kuuga, with square-like segments at the back of the fingers. It also has a hand pad at the back of the hands, which is midnight green in Pegasus Form.

Knee Protector: The golden kneeguards of Kuuga's legs. In Mighty Form, the large, diagonal oval-shaped orb in the centre is midnight green.

Ancient Ankler: The golden ankle braces on Kuuga's Ankles. In Pegasus Form, the small orbs on the left and right of the bracelets are green, which can glow a different colour if Kuuga unlocks another form.

Warrior's feet: The black foot armour of Kuuga's feet. The soles have a Rinto hieroglyph that'll be shown when Kuuga performs the Mighty Kick.

8.content:
Pegasus Bowgun: The Pegasus Bowgun is a crossbow exclusively for Kamen Rider Kuuga in their Pegasus Form, created by picking up something that makes him imagine "an objects that shoot through" such as gun-like object, commonly. Pull the Trigger Lever on the butt of the gun once to narrow down the aim, absorb the air energy from the muzzle, and release the Trigger Lever to shoot the air bullet Pegasus Arrow with the compressed sealed energy. The Rinto hieroglyphics of "Gale" indicating Pegasus Form is drawn on the spirit stone embedded in the rear of the muzzle, and the barrel is repeatedly engraved with the Rinto hieroglyphics: "Come! It's a Pegasus' bow that can fly high in the sky!"

Pegasus Bowgun components:

Bow Caser: The black casing of the Pegasus Bowgun. It also has a golden strip going across the left and right of it with Rinto hieroglyphics written across it that translates to "Come! It's a Pegasus' bow that can fly high in the sky!"

Pegasus Barrel: The golden barrel of the Pegasus Bowgun. It has two bow pieces that move back when the Pegasus Hammer is pulled and has Rinto hieroglyphics written across it.

Pegasus Spirit Stone: The green spirit stones embedded at the sides of the Pegasus Bowgun's casing, surrounded by gold. The ones at the rear of the muzzle has the symbol of Kuuga's Pegasus Form, while the ones on the near bottom of the casing are where air gathered through the muzzle is converted into energy.

Pegasi Muzzle: The muzzle of the Pegasus Bowgun. When the hammer, known as the Trigger Lever, is pulled back, the surrounding air is sucked in and converted into energy, and when the Pegasi Trigger is pulled, the Trigger Lever snaps back into place and shoots a powerful hot air bullet called the Pegasus Arrow is shot out at high speeds.

Trigger Lever: The golden hammer of the Pegasus Bowgun.

Pegasi Trigger: The black trigger of the Pegasus Bowgun.

---

Rising Pegasus Bowgun: The Rising Pegasus Bowgun is the Pegasus Bowgun that has been enhanced and deformed with a golden bayonet with the Rising Power on the top of the barrel, once Kuuga upgrades to Rising Pegasus Form. The Rinto hieroglyphics engraved on the additional part means "Add the power of lightning to calm the wickedness." Like the Pegasus Bowgun, weapons such as bows and guns can be used to transform into the Rising Pegasus Bowgun by receiving the Morphing Power released from Kuuga's hands. The shooting range is greatly extended and continuous rapid fire is possible, and several Pegasus Arrows are fired with one shot.

Kuuga, in their Ultimate Form, can summon the Rising Pegasus Bowgun for Ultimate Pegasus Bowgun. The green accents on the weapon turn black in colour.

Rising Pegasus Bowgun components:

Bow Caser: The black casing of the Rising Pegasus Bowgun. It also has a golden strip going across the left and right of it with Rinto hieroglyphics written across it that translates to "Come! It's a Pegasus' bow that can fly high in the sky!"

Pegasus Barrel: The golden barrel of the Rising Pegasus Bowgun. It has two bow pieces that move back when the Pegasus Hammer is pulled and has Rinto hieroglyphics written across it.

Pegasus Spirit Stone: The green spirit stones embedded at the sides of the Rising Pegasus Bowgun's casing, surrounded by gold. The ones at the rear of the muzzle has the symbol of Kuuga's Pegasus Form, while the ones on the near bottom of the casing are where air gathered through the muzzle is converted into energy.

Pegasi Muzzle: The muzzle of the Rising Pegasus Bowgun. When the hammer, known as the Trigger Lever, is pulled back, the surrounding air is sucked in and converted into energy, and when the Pegasi Trigger is pulled, the Trigger Lever snaps back into place and shoots a powerful hot air bullet called the Pegasus Arrow at high speeds.

Rising Beyonet: The large, golden beyonet, in the shape of two blades, on the left and right of the Rising Pegasus Bowgun.

Trigger Lever: The golden hammer of the Rising Pegasus Bowgun.

Pegasi Trigger: The black trigger of the Rising Pegasus Bowgun.

9.content:
Rider form name: Titan Form

Form belongs to: Kuuga

Amadam colour: Purple

Titan Form is Kuuga's herculean purple & silver form, it sacrifices speed for increased durability and strength. Titan Form's impenetrable defenses allow Kuuga to endure enemy attacks long enough to approach the opponents. He is armed with the Titan Sword, which can be transformed from pole-like objects, the handle of Kuuga's bike, or an enemy's weapon.

In Titan Form, Kuuga is stronger and has a higher defence than the other base forms, however, their speed is reduced, meaning they could only approach their enemies by walking.

Titan Form's finishing move is the "Calamity Titan", a powerful sword thrust wherein Kuuga twists the blade as it is impaled.

Titan Form's appearance:

HEAD:

Head Shell: The smooth, black exoskeleton-like structure of Kuuga's head, which is the most sturdy part of the body. It protects the brain from all impacts.

Warrior's Crosshorn: Kuuga's golden crosshorn, located at the front of Kuuga's head, which has two prominent horns on each side of the head that are slightly over the eyes, a smaller one at the centre and a piece that goes down the face until it touches the top of the Stag Mouth. It also has a purple orb at the centre.

Stag Eyes: The slightly large compound eyes of Kuuga. In Titan Form, it is purple and gives Kuuga eyesight 10x stronger than that of a normal human.

Warrior's gold: The golden trim that goes around the bottom of Kuuga's helmet, which goes a bit over the mouthpiece and connects to the bottom of the Warrior's Eyes. It also contains barely noticeable Rinto hieroglyphics written across it.

Stag Mouth: The metal mouthpiece of Kuuga's head, which has small structures on it which give it a look like an insect's mandibles. It also has a metal chinstrap that protects the jaw and holds the main body of the Stag Mouth.

Warrior's Ear: The black, slightly curved diamond-shaped pieces at each side of Kuuga's head. In Titan Form, it gives Kuuga hearing 10x stronger than that of a normal human.

BODY:

Bio skin: The black armoured skin that covers the entire body. It has both supple elasticity and diamond-like hardness.

Titan Chestplate: Kuuga's chestplate in Titan Form. It is silver and has purple L-shaped ridges on both the left and right and the top half of the neckguard. The purple ridges contain Rinto hieroglyphics written across them. It is made of an unknown supermetal, which can protect the wearer from high-powered energy blasts and explosions to a certain extent, showing the strength of Titan Form.

Titan Paudrons: Kuuga's shoulder pauldrons in Titan Form. It looks slightly raised at the end and has purple ridges on it, with Rinto hieroglyphics written across it.  It is made of an unknown supermetal, which can protect the wearer from high-powered energy blasts and explosions to a certain extent, showing the strength of Titan Form.

Forearm Guard: The forearm wraps that cover Kuuga's forearms. They have a golden trim at the top and are silver in Titan Form.

Ancient Bracers: The golden bracelets on Kuuga's wrists. In Titan Form, the small orbs on the left and right of the bracelets are purple.

Warrior's hands: The black glove-like hands of Kuuga, with square-like segments at the back of the fingers. It also has a hand pad at the back of the hands, which is silver in Titan Form.

Knee Protector: The golden kneeguards of Kuuga's legs. In Titan Form, the large, diagonal oval-shaped orb in the centre is purple.

Ancient Ankler: The golden ankle braces on Kuuga's Ankles. In Titan Form, the small orbs on the left and right of the bracelets are purple, which can glow a different colour if Kuuga unlocks another form.

Warrior's feet: The black foot armour of Kuuga's feet. The soles have a Rinto hieroglyph that'll be shown when Kuuga performs the Mighty Kick.

10.content:
Titan Sword: The Titan Sword is an extendable two-handed, straight-bladed, double-edged sword used by Kuuga in their Titan Form that can be created out of pole or stick-like objects, normally the control handle of his bike. His finishing move with the Titan Sword is known as Calamity Titan, which is a powerful sword thrust wherein Kuuga twists the blade as it is impaled.

Titan Sword Components:

Power Handle: The grip of the Titan sword. It is indigo in colour and has a ridged-like pattern. It also has golden diagonal strips on the left and right of it, with Rinto Hieroglyphs written across it.

Power Forger: The golden bottom of the Titan Sword. It has a small purple on the left and right of it.

Titan Crossguard: The golden crossguards of the Titan Sword. It looks like Kuuga's crosshorns have a purple spirit ball embedded at the centre, with the Titan written inside.

Titan Blade: The blade of the Titan Sword. It is purple in colour, and the top can extend at Kuuga's will. It has a golden diagonal strip across it that has Rinto hieroglyphs written across it.

---

Rising Titan Sword: After assuming Rising Titan, Kuuga uses the Rising Titan Sword („É©„Ç§„Ç∏„É≥„Ç∞„Çø„Ç§„Çø„É≥„ÇΩ„Éº„Éâ, Raijingu Taitan S≈çdo) for the Rising Calamity Titan („É©„Ç§„Ç∏„É≥„Ç∞„Ç´„É©„Éü„ÉÜ„Ç£„Çø„Ç§„Çø„É≥, Raijingu Karamiti Taitan) finisher. He can also create a second Rising Titan Sword to use in the Double Rising Calamity Titan („ÉÄ„Éñ„É´„É©„Ç§„Ç∏„É≥„Ç∞„Ç´„É©„Éü„ÉÜ„Ç£„Çø„Ç§„Çø„É≥, Daburu Raijingu Karamiti Taitan) attack.

Kuuga, in their Ultimate Form, can summon the Rising Titan Sword for the Ultimate Rising Titan Sword. The purple accents on the weapon turn black in colour.

Rising Titan Sword Components:

Power Handle: The grip of the Rising Titan sword. It is indigo in colour and has a ridged-like pattern. It also has golden diagonal strips on the left and right of it, with Rinto Hieroglyphs written across it.

Power Forger: The golden bottom of the Rising Titan Sword. It has a small purple on the left and right of it.

Titan Crossguard: The golden crossguards of the Rising Titan Sword. It looks like Kuuga's crosshorns have a purple spirit ball embedded at the centre, with the Titan written inside.

Titan Blade: The blade of the Rising Titan Sword. It is purple in colour, and the top can extend at Kuuga's will. It has a golden diagonal strip across it that has Rinto hieroglyphs written across it.

Rising Titan Blade: The large and slightly spiked extended blade of the Rising Titan Sword. At the bottom, it has Rinto hieroglyphs written across it.
