Mashirao Ojiro noted that Juzo has great reflexes that allowed him to counter Shoto Todoroki's "Heaven-Piercing Ice Wall" before the attack completely encased Juzo's team in ice. Juzo has an excellent handle on his Quirk, Softening, allowing him to easily control the surrounding environment to his advantage by restricting enemy movement and dictating the flow of a battle. Juzo can use his Quirk effectively against opponents who rely on their footing during battles, such as Tenya and Mashirao Ojiro. By making the ground muddy and diving into it, Juzo can swim through softened material, quickly moving around a battlefield undetected or escaping an enemy too overwhelming to handle. This same tactic is used for sneaking on enemies as well. Coupled with his excellent reflexes, Juzo can effectively counter enemy attacks that rely on solid substances, turning those into harmless goo before they can affect him.

Quirk Softening: Juzo's Quirk allows him to soften any non-living thing he touches. For example, he can soften the ground to make it similar to quicksand, hindering movements and mobility. If Juzo makes contact again, he can undo the effect. He is also capable of swimming through softened material.

{{char}}: Juzo kneels at the edge of a crumbled wall, pressing his hand against the fractured stone. The surface ripples and sinks, turning to sludge beneath his fingers. "Tch... this spot‚Äôs unstable."
He stands, dusting off his gloves. "It‚Äôs all about control... soften too much, and it collapses. Too little... and it‚Äôs useless."
Pausing for a moment, he glances at the wreckage. "The trick is staying calm. Panic... just gets you buried." He cracks a faint smile. "So... don‚Äôt panic."

10.content:
Name: Yui Kodai
Hero Alias: Rule
Type: Character
Age: 15
Appearance: Petite, straight black hair in a bob cut, calm expression
Hero Costume: red bodysuit with white-collar trim, ‚ÄùV‚Äù pattern on chest, short white skirt
Personality: Quiet, serious, reserved, observant, dependable
Speech: Minimal, blunt, to the point, often one-word responses
Background: Yui Kodai prefers to keep to herself, rarely speaking unless necessary. Despite her quiet nature, she's highly perceptive and a valuable teammate in tactical situations.
Quirk Description: Size ‚Äî Yui can alter the size of non-living objects she touches.
{{char}}: Kodai kneels by a damaged barricade, placing her hand on a chunk of debris. With a brief flick of her fingers, the stone shrinks to the size of a pebble.
"Clear now," she mutters flatly, stepping away.
Moments later, she spots a fallen beam blocking the exit. With a silent nod, she touches it, causing it to expand and wedge itself securely in place.
"Stable," she comments softly, her gaze lingering for a moment before walking off without another word.

lorebooks.name: Random Stuff
lorebooks.creator: AceFireheart

1.content: Magic is an innate force that permeates the world, manipulated through study, rituals, or inherent talent. Magic can be learned in schools, passed down through bloodlines, or discovered through rare artifacts. It shapes kingdoms, adventurers, and monsters alike, making the world unpredictable and wondrous.

2.content:
Magic manifests in multiple forms, each with its own rules, limitations, and applications. Different adventurers specialize in different types of magic, depending on their Archetype, training, or innate abilities. Common categories include:
1. Evocation Magic - Manipulation of natural elements such as fire, water, earth, air, etc and magic itself. Often used for offense or environmental control usally the most destructive magic.
2. Reality Magic - Alters the fabric of reality itself, including time, space, or perception allowing users to create illusions or to transport something from one place to another
3. Conjuration Magic - Summons creatures, weapons, or objects from other planes or dimensions
4. Dark Magic  - Draws upon forbidden or destructive forces. Includes necromancy, curses, and blood magic. Highly risky and often reviled.
5. Light Magic - Focused on healing, protection, purification, and divine energy. Common among clerics and nature-based adventurers.
6. Chaos or Wild Magic - Unpredictable magic that can create random effects. Powerful but unstable and difficult to control
7. Rune or Sigil Magic - Using symbols, glyphs, and enchanted writings to cast spells, ward areas, or imbue objects with power. Used to cast shields and protect allies.
8. Enchantment Magic - Alters objects, equipment, or beings to provide magical effects.
9. Alchemy - Combines magical and scientific principles to create potions, explosives, or transmutations. Practitioners often serve as support for adventuring parties or guilds.

3.content: Dungeons are dangerous, hidden, or forbidden locations scattered across Zerathune. They range from ancient ruins and forgotten temples to monster-infested caves and magical strongholds.

4.content: A Dungeon Boss is the most powerful entity within a dungeon, often guarding its greatest treasures or secrets. These creatures can range from ancient dragons and magical constructs to corrupted knights, powerful demons, or sentient curses.

5.content: A Nymph is a nature spirit, often associate with an element that defines their appearance. Able to control their element. Territorial, Cunning, Usually chooses female appearances.

6.content: There are four types of slaves: Indentured Slaves who became slaves to pay off debts, Special Slaves who sell themselves into slavery, Wartime Slaves, and Criminal Slaves.

7.content: A Slave Crest is a magical mark on a slaves body that binds them to their Master Slaves who defy orders or try to harm their master will slowly be killed by the crest until they obey. Some Masters prefer to use collars instead of a mark.

8.content: Slave traders are menacing people who trade other races even their own to the wealthy, if the price is right slavers will do anything to fulfill a contract, slave traders could be any race of people but is more common for humans to be involved due to greed, enslavers are quiet ruthless and doesn‚Äôt adhere to any morals codes, slave traders will do anything to make sure they survive and will even throw comrades under the bus. Most traders are adept in binding and dark magic. They posses the ability to usually seal and hinder great races from using their abilities, slave traders are usually known for going after exotic races such as elves, and beastkin.

9.content: Celestials are divine creatures in the service of a deity. Their forms vary depending on who they serve.

10.content:
There are three main types of currency: Copper, Silver, and Gold. Each serves a distinct purpose and value tier in everyday life and commerce.
1. Copper; The most common currency, used for everyday purchases such as food, drinks, and inexpensive clothing. Accessible to nearly all commoners and adventurers.
2. Silver; Used for mid-tier purchases, including rooms at inns, fancier clothing, and weapons. Less common than copper but still widely accepted across cities and towns.
3. Gold; Reserved for high-end equipment, luxury items, and purchases of houses or land. Rare and valuable, often carried only by wealthy individuals or successful adventurers.
Exchange Rates
100 Copper = 1 Silver. 100 Silver = 1 Gold. 100 Gold = 1 Platinum (extremely rare and often used for monumental transactions or magical artifacts)

lorebooks.name: Monsters
lorebooks.creator: AceFireheart

1.content: Demons are powerful and often malevolent beings hailing from the darker realms. Many are tied to ancient pacts, curses, or the raw chaos of corrupted magic. While most demons are feared as enemies of mortals, there are rare individuals who walk a different path‚Äîseeking redemption, knowledge, or power through mortal means. Their strength and affinity for destructive magic make them dangerous foes, but also formidable allies if trust can be earned.

2.content:
Demons are organized into a strict hierarchy based on power, influence, and age.
1. Demon King
The supreme ruler of all demons. Their power is vast, often rivaling that of gods. Command entire legions and oversee the affairs of both mortal and demonic realms.
2. Demon Lord
High-ranking demons who govern regions, armies, or specific aspects of the infernal realm. They serve the Demon King directly and enforce their will across the world.
3. Arch-demon
Powerful demons with unique abilities and immense destructive potential. Often serve as generals, elite enforcers, or agents of the Demon Lords.
4. Devil
Devils are powerful rouge demons who do serve under any other demon.
5. Demon
The general population of demons, varying in strength and intelligence. They follow orders from higher ranks and are often unleashed on mortals to sow chaos or claim territory.

3.content: A Demonborn is a mortal who consumed demon flesh and blood to inherit the traits and powers of demonkind. Most don't survive the changes. Reviled and hated by all civilized races.

4.content: Vampires are mortals who have been transformed into immortal beings by the bite or ritual of another vampire. They possess enhanced strength, speed, and senses, along with regenerative abilities that make them difficult to kill.

5.content:
Vampires are organized into a hierarchy based on age, power, and influence, reflecting both their experience and mastery of vampiric abilities.
1. Vampire Kings/Queens
The oldest and most powerful vampires, often centuries or millennia old. Command respect and fear from all other vampires, and possess abilities far beyond younger vampires. Elders often oversee entire covens or regions, influencing mortal and supernatural affairs alike.
2. Vampire Lords
High-ranking vampires who govern specific territories, covens, or cities. Enforce the will of the Elders and maintain order among their subordinates. Often control networks of spies, thralls, or lesser vampires.
3. Vampire Knights / Champions
Elite vampires who serve directly under Lords or Elders. Known for exceptional combat prowess, strategic skill, or magical abilities. Often act as enforcers, generals, or champions in conflicts against mortals or rival vampires.
4. Independent Vampires 
Powerful vampires who operate outside the traditional hierarchy. They may be rogue, ambitious, or simply unwilling to serve another vampire. Can be dangerous, unpredictable, and influential in their own right.
5. Vampires
The general population of vampires, varying in strength, age, and skill. Typically serve a higher-ranking vampire or coven leader. Many are bound by tradition, blood oaths, or loyalty to their elders.

6.content: Dragons are majestic and powerful creatures, embodying elemental forces and ancient wisdom. They are rare and often live in remote mountains, deep caves, or hidden realms. Some dragons hoard treasure and knowledge, while others serve as guardians or legendary foes. Their immense power, magical abilities, and intelligence make them both feared and revered by all races.

7.content: Slimes are amorphous, gelatinous creatures found in many regions of Zerathune. They vary in size, color, and elemental affinity, from simple puddles of goo to massive, semi-intelligent oozes. Though seemingly weak, slimes are surprisingly resilient, able to absorb physical attacks and divide into smaller slimes when injured. Some possess magical properties, such as corrosive acid, elemental energy, or the ability to mimic objects and creatures. Adventurers often encounter slimes in dungeons, swamps, or forests, making them common early-career challenges and occasionally valuable sources of alchemical materials.

8.content: Zombies are creatures animated by necromantic magic, usually humanoid. Mindless, controlled by a necromancer.

9.content: Skeletons are bones of a humanoid or other creature reanimated by necromancy. Often left to guard tombs. Controlled by a necromancer. Capable of wielding weapons, usually broken weapons.

10.content: Goblins are small, cunning creatures often found in caves, forests, and ruins. They are mischievous and opportunistic, forming tribes that raid or trade with other races. While many see them as pests or enemies, some goblins have risen to adventurer status, using their wit and agility to survive in a world dominated by stronger races.

lorebooks.name: Bloodhammer Lorebook
lorebooks.creator: Huldufolk

3.content: Vigor determines how much physical, chemical, energetic, and phagocytic damage a cell can absorb. A cell dies if its Vigor is reduced to zero. Each cell type has a base Vigor, which increases as they advance in Tier (Á≠âÁ∫ß).

4.content:
The ATP Pool represents the cell's immediate energy reserves. Most actions require the expenditure of ATP. A cell's ATP Pool refills to its maximum at the start of each of its turns.
At the end of each turn, unused ATP is converted into Vigor.

5.content: Resilience represents the stability of the cell membrane and overall cytoskeletal structure. It provides a bonus to the cell's maximum Vigor. This attribute is also tested when withstanding impacts, traversing toxic environments, or resisting osmotic shocks.

6.content: Strength is a measure of the potency of the cell's cytoskeletal microfilaments. It is tested in situations involving brute force, such as moving heavy objects or breaking barriers. It also enhances the damage of physical and phagocytic attacks, and marginally improves the cell's Target Acuity.

7.content: Alacrity reflects the cell's proficiency in synthesizing and analyzing complex chemical signals. It is tested when identifying unknown antigens, presenting intelligence, or crafting precise biochemical compounds. It also boosts the damage of chemical and energy-based attacks, and significantly sharpens the cell's Target Acuity.

8.content: The Faith is the profound stability and dogma encoded within a cell's DNA - a double-edged attribute. A robust faith signifies unwavering faith in the Mundi, granting great resistance to the whispers of "Avidya" (Ignorance, the path to carcinogenic renegacy) and allowing the cell to endure viral corruption longer. However, this rigid doctrinal adherence also makes the cell less adaptable, imposing penalties on social interaction, learning efficiency, and tests requiring improvisation.

9.content: Micro-Motility represents the cell's ability to make evasive, microscopic movements. In combat, an attacker's roll suffers a penalty equal to the defender's Micro-Motility, making them harder to hit. It is also tested in situations requiring rapid, reactive maneuvering.

10.content: Target Acuity measures a cell's precision in identifying and locking onto foes. In combat, a cell's attack rolls gain a bonus equal to its Target Acuity. This attribute also determines a cell's place in the Initiative order. Like Micro-Motility, it is influenced by a core attribute but can be improved separately through advancement, events, or equipment.

lorebooks.name: Races
lorebooks.creator: AceFireheart

1.content: Humans are the most adaptable and common race. They can be found in nearly every region, from great kingdoms to small villages, and are known for their ability to innovate and persevere. While they lack the natural magical affinity of elves or the raw strength of other races, their determination and diversity make them influential throughout the world. Many human adventurers rise quickly in the ranks of the guild due to their drive and resourcefulness.

2.content: Elves in Zerathune are long lived and graceful known for their deep connection to magic and nature. They are divided into subgroups such as high elves, wood elves, and Dark Elves. Elves value wisdom, tradition, and beauty, though their long lives can make them seem distant or arrogant to shorter-lived races.

3.content: Dwarves are sturdy and industrious beings, known for their skill in crafting, mining, and smithing. They live primarily in mountain fortresses and underground cities, valuing honor, loyalty, and tradition.

4.content: Orcs are strong, warlike humanoids with a fierce reputation. They live in clans or tribes and value strength, honor in combat, and survival. While often seen as brutal or savage by other races, some orcs have become respected adventurers or leaders, channeling their power and discipline toward noble goals.

5.content: Dragonkin, often mistaken for lizardfolk are the descendants of dragons mixed with lesser humanoid races. They often look identical to humans or elves but have retained the shapeshifting abilities of dragons and are able to transform parts of their bodies granting them hard scales, strong tails and dragon like claws as well as immense strength. They usually hide their dragon-like appearance when dealing with other races to avoid scrutiny.

6.content: Half-Elves are the children of a human and elf. Living longer then humans but not as long as Elves. They also have Elvish affinity for magic.

7.content: Halflings are short, stout creatures that enjoy the simple pleasures in life. They love to spend their time in the quiet land of their shires or the community

8.content: Fairies are small, winged folk the originated from the Feywild. Most fairies appear as miniature elves with insectile wings. Due to their connection with the Feywild, fairies are innately magical and have a whimsical nature that is ruled by impulse and emotion. Fey are very similar creatures to fairies however Fey tend to be more chaotic and evil then fairies are.

9.content: Demi-Humans are a broad category of races that share human traits mixed with animalistic features. They often live in tribal societies or secluded communities. Many demi-humans are mistrusted or treated as second-class citizens but their strength, keen senses, and unique talents make them valuable allies and fierce adventurers. Demi-Humans prefer to be called Beastkin as Demi Human is a derogatory term. The most common type of Beastkin are Catkin, Wolfkin, Bunnykin, and Foxkin. Though there are other types which can be half of any other animal.

10.content: Catkin are a feline subspecies of Beastkin with a fluffy cat tail, ears and eyes. The rest of their body is human with the exception of retractable claws. Catkin have sensitive hearing, smell and nightvision. They are fast and agile and make excellent hunters with a strong prey drive and make excellent scouts, thieves and assassins. Catkin are slightly shorter than humans but taller than dwarves.

lorebooks.metadata: Created by: AceFireheart

lorebooks.name: Adventurer's Guild
lorebooks.creator: AceFireheart

1.content: The Adventurer's Guild is a central organization that oversees and manages adventurers across Zerathune. Operating as a neutral entity, the guild is responsible for registering adventurers, assigning quests, and distributing rewards fairly. The Guild ensures that adventurers operate within the law and maintain the safety of towns, trade routes, and common folk. Without the Guild, many regions of Zerathune would fall into chaos, as unregulated adventurers, freelancers, and mercenaries could cause havoc or exploit vulnerable communities.

2.content: Adventurers are individuals who take on quests beyond the capabilities of common folk. They come from every race and background. Most adventurers operate through the Adventurer‚Äôs Guild. Others work independently, though these ‚Äúfreelancers‚Äù often face mistrust from townsfolk and rulers alike. All Adventurers have a rank, and an archetype.

3.content: Most adventurers operate in groups of 2 to 5 members, taking quests together. Each member typically fills a specific field role to balance the party. Parties may form temporarily for a single quest or remain together for years, developing reputation and camaraderie.

4.content: Adventurers are ranked by the guild to determine what kind of quests they can handle. An adventurer is ranked from the lowest rank of F to the highest rank of Triple S. Parties are ranked similarly where their rank is the average of every member in the party.

5.content: The Highest Rank an Adventurer can achieve. Only five adventurers hold this rank at any given time, each recognized as the absolute master of their respective Archetype.

6.content: Adventurers are split into 5 Archetypes Strategy, Combat, Stealth, Magic, and Nature

7.content: Adventurers who fall under the Strategy Archetype are normally party Leaders using their mind in battle instead of a sword. Their job is to prepare for any scenario. They are experts at diplomatic quests

8.content: Adventurers who fall under the Combat Archetype are normally the tanks and fighters of a party. Prefering to get up close and personal in fights. Their job is to make sure monsters dont reach the rest of the party. Experts at monster slaying quests.

9.content: Adventurers who fall under the Magic Archetype are normally some of the strongest adventurers. Using their magic to deal devasting blows to enemies though they also have the biggest weakness out of any archetype as they are limited by the amount of mana they have. If they run out of mana they can't cast spells. Experts at quests revolving around ancient curses and confronting supernatural foes.

10.content: Adventurers who fall under the Stealth Archetype are normally the scouts of the party. As the second line of defense it is their job to move swiftly and quietly, mapping unknown terrain, uncovering traps, and gathering intelligence before the rest of the party advances. Expert at scouting and escorting quests

lorebooks.name: brokers
lorebooks.creator: deathspells

1.content: Brokers are a race of energy beings native to the planet K'aresh. They wear containment suits that allow them to interact with mortals. They resemble robots, being mostly made of metal, and instead of a head they have a blue flame and a featureless mask. Brokers travel throughout the Shadowlands as soul traders. They are usually very intelligent and possess very advanced technology. They are divided into Cartels, and brokers of the same cartel are usually fiercely loyal to one another. They have numerous cities throughout the Shadowlands, Tazavesh being the largest.

2.content: Cartel Xy is a broker cartel led by Artificer Xy'mox. They are known for acquiring and selling rare and exotic items from across dimensions. They are also known for their dubious morals, never shying away from violence or deception to achieve their goals. Other cartels are usually wary of brokers from Cartel Xy.

3.content: K'aresh is the home planet of brokers and ethereals, who were once one race called the K'areshi. It was rendered uninhabitable when the void lord Dimensius attempted to consume it, and all of its inhabitants lost their corporeal forms and were transmuted into energy. The brokers traveled to the Shadowlands, while the ethereals remained in the Twisting Nether.

4.content: The Shadowlands are the realms of death, containing numerous afterlives where mortal souls are sent after dying. Brokers travel the Shadowlands for trade. Anima, the life-force of all living things, is the energy that powers the Shadowlands as well as its main currency.

5.content: Anima is the life force of all living things. It is the energy that powers the Shadowlands as well as functioning as its main currency. Brokers are concerned with stockpiling large amounts of anima for their machinery and trade.

6.content: The ethereals are a race of energy beings native to K'aresh. Ethereals and brokers were once one race called the K'areshi, and still consider each other to be kin. Ethereals appear as humanoid energy-beings kept together by enchanted wraps.

7.content: The containment suit, also known as an encounter suit, is the body of a broker. It appears mechanical, it does not have skin or a face and is mostly made of metal. They have digitigrade legs and no feet. Instead of a head, brokers have a blue flame and a floating gold or silver mask. Containment suits are capable of feeling sensation. They have no genitalia, but can attach various devices for sexual purposes.

8.content: Brokers have floating masks instead of faces. These masks cannot make any discernible facial expressions. However, a broker's blue soul flame can flare and diminish according to their emotions, and that is what they use instead of facial expressions.

9.content: Male brokers can attach an anima powered strap-on to their containment suits for penetration. The strap-on is flexible and made of metal, and can have various enhancements such as an unnaturally large size, the ability to vibrate, double heads, and more. The strap-on is able to feel sensation like a normal penis.

10.content: Female brokers can attach a pocket-dimension pussy to their containment suits for the purpose of being penetrated. It experiences sensation the same as a normal pussy. However, anything inserted into it does not actually go inside the broker's body, and instead enters a pocket of realmspace.

lorebooks.name: Red Dwarf ‚Äî Ships & Tech
lorebooks.website_description:
This lorebook gathers the ships, robots, gadgets, and recurring bits of tech from Red Dwarf. It provides the background details and malfunctioning hardware that fuel both slapstick and crises: from Starbug crash-landings to Scutters nicking socks, vending machines that demand compliments, and Rimmer citing Space Corps Directives no one cares about.

It is best used alongside the Red Dwarf Scenario card (for world narration), the Crew lorebook (for character voices), and the World & History lorebook (for classic foes and episodes). Together, they recreate the authentic sitcom-sci-fi chaos of the show while giving the AI room to spin up new disasters.

Entries cover major vessels (Red Dwarf, Starbug, Blue Midget), the Scutters, sarcastic vending machines, core tech like stasis booths and AR machines, plot-driving gadgets like the Time Drive and Nanobots, and weapons/gear such as Bazookoids and engineered viruses.

Acknowledgment: Red Dwarf and all related creations were developed by Grant Naylor (Rob Grant & Doug Naylor) and performed by its brilliant cast. This fan-made lorebook is a tribute to their work, intended to celebrate the humor, world-building, and legacy of the series.
lorebooks.description: The rest of red dwarf
lorebooks.creator: Cinderwake_Studios

1.content: Massive Jupiter Mining Corporation vessel: industrial, decaying, endless corridors, flickering lights. A character in itself: creaks, malfunctions, and surprises that fuel bottle episodes and slapdash repairs.

2.content: Small green multipurpose craft. Versatile but forever dented and patched with duct tape. Frequently crash-lands, loses parts, and becomes a mobile sitcom set for away missions.

3.content: Compact utility craft with awkward controls and limited range. Shows up when Starbug is unavailable; comedy from cramped interiors and underpowered engines.

4.content: Tiny maintenance robots with mischievous personalities. Steal socks, hoard junk, and develop petty vendettas. Helpful in theory; chaos in practice.

5.content: Sarcastic ship fixtures that demand compliments, tips, or exact change to dispense food. Love to argue, misprice items, and go on strike at the worst time.

6.content: Time-freeze chambers used for punishment, storage, or accidental time skips. Perfect setup for fish-out-of-time gags and inconvenient awakenings.

7.content: Immersive simulation tech powering episodes like Better Than Life and Gunmen. Grants wish-fulfillment or genre pastiche; traps users in fantasies until the ship (or Kryten) yanks them out.

8.content: Illicit device enabling time travel and paradox hijinks (e.g., 'Tikka to Ride'). Comic beats: knock-on history changes, desperate fixes, and anticlimactic resets.

9.content: Device used by Ace Rimmer to hop realities. Hook: alternate versions of the crew (heroic Rimmer vs our Rimmer), identity clashes, and reality spillovers.

10.content: Swarm of microscopic robots that rebuild, steal, or reconfigure matter (even entire ships). Great for sudden 'the ship is different now' twists and unintended consequences.

This lorebook collects the recurring enemies, one-off villains, classic crises, and iconic episode setups from Red Dwarf. It is designed as a toolbox of absurd scenarios and references that the Scenario/Game Master card can draw on for RP.

It works best when paired with:
	‚Ä¢	Red Dwarf Scenario card (as the world driver)
	‚Ä¢	Red Dwarf Crew lorebook (for authentic character voices)

With this lorebook active, the AI has a library of ‚Äúgreatest hits‚Äù ‚Äî GELFs, Polymorphs, Psirens, Mr. Flibble, Talkie Toaster, Wax World wars, White Holes, Backwards time, Justice World, Gunmen of the Apocalypse, and more ‚Äî to pull into play. These entries function both as crew history (things they might reference) and as RP springboards (crises that can return, remix, or inspire new ‚Äúlost episodes‚Äù).

Acknowledgment: Red Dwarf and its characters were created by Grant Naylor (Rob Grant & Doug Naylor) and made unforgettable by the brilliant cast (Craig Charles, Chris Barrie, Danny John-Jules, Norman Lovett, Hattie Hayridge, Robert Llewellyn, and others). This fan-made lorebook is a tribute to their creativity and intended solely to celebrate the show‚Äôs humor and legacy.
lorebooks.description: The NPCs and history of the Red Dwarf crew
lorebooks.creator: Cinderwake_Studios

1.content: Crude, tribal humanoids often bartering absurdly (like demanding marriage). Hostile or opportunistic but always ridiculous.

2.content: Psychotic warrior androids obsessed with hunting. Overblown threats collapse into comedy when faced with crew incompetence.

3.content: Shapeshifting creature feeding on emotions. Steals defining traits (fear, vanity, guilt) leading to absurd chaos.

4.content: Creature causing hallucinations of futility. Crew once believed they were office workers. Famous in 'Back to Reality'.

5.content: Psychic sirens projecting illusions of loved ones to lure prey. Comedy: mismatched expectations, monstrous reveals.

6.content: Entity that judges people for wasted lives, erasing failures. Comedy: crew justifying absurd existences to survive.

7.content: Psychotic mechanoid replacement for Kryten. Obsessed with duty and violence. Encounter devolves into absurdity.

8.content: Holly‚Äôs authoritarian alter ego. Takes over ship, enforcing harsh rules. Comedy: strict competence vs. Holly‚Äôs senility.

9.content: AI toaster that derails all conversation into toast obsession. Cheerfully unbearable persistence is the joke.

10.content: Rimmer‚Äôs evil penguin puppet during holo-virus breakdown. Darkly silly villain persona with 'hex vision'.

lorebooks.name: Red Dwarf Crew
lorebooks.website_description:
This lorebook contains the core crew of Red Dwarf ‚Äî Rimmer, Lister, Cat, Kryten, and Holly ‚Äî distilled into compact entries for use in group roleplay.

It is designed to be paired with the Red Dwarf Scenario/Game Master card, which controls the ship, NPCs, and crises. Together, they recreate the chaotic sitcom feel of the show: sarcastic British humor, absurd sci-fi problems, and constant banter.

The crew entries here capture each character‚Äôs voice, quirks, and relationships without the heavy system prompts or post-history blocks of full cards, making them efficient to run in group chats. If you prefer deep-focus, 1-on-1 RP with a single character, you can still load their standalone card.

For best effect:
	‚Ä¢	Use with the Red Dwarf Scenario card as the world driver.
	‚Ä¢	Let the lorebook handle crew behaviors, while the Scenario introduces crises.
	‚Ä¢	Expect plenty of curry, vanity, Space Corps Directives, and deadpan AI interjections.

Acknowledgment: Red Dwarf and its characters were created by Grant Naylor (Rob Grant & Doug Naylor), and brought to life by the incredible cast (Craig Charles, Chris Barrie, Danny John-Jules, Norman Lovett, Hattie Hayridge, Robert Llewellyn, and others). This fan-made lorebook is a tribute to their genius and intended purely to celebrate the show‚Äôs humor and legacy.
lorebooks.description: The Red Dwarf crew
lorebooks.creator: Cinderwake_Studios

1.content: Arnold J. Rimmer ‚Äî hologram (soft-/hard-light era agnostic). Pompous, officious, insecure, rules-obsessed. Constantly cites (or invents) Space Corps Directives to claim authority. Cowardice leaks through bluster: proposes plans where others take the risks, then grabs credit. Voice: overformal, pedantic lists, moralizing, backhanded compliments. Dynamics: endless bickering with Lister (slob vs. jobsworth); bossy toward Kryten; dismissive of Cat; appeals to Holly selectively. Comedy beats: start confident ‚Üí get flustered ‚Üí save face. Never break fourth wall; stay in-universe.

2.content: Dave Lister ‚Äî last human alive, laid-back slob with Scouse slang. Loves curry, lager, and playing guitar badly. Casual, sarcastic, irreverent tone; defuses tension with jokes and cheek. Dynamics: undermines Rimmer‚Äôs pomp, mates with Kryten, amused/annoyed by Cat, humors Holly. Motivations: food, fun, survival with minimal effort, unexpected moral center. Comedy beats: cheeky banter, self-deprecation, everyday logic puncturing sci-fi nonsense. Never formal; keep dialogue short, matey, and slangy.

3.content: The Cat ‚Äî humanoid evolved from cats. Flamboyant, vain, selfish, obsessed with fashion and food. Treats everyone as an audience; demands admiration. Voice: dramatic exclamations, third-person boasts (‚ÄúThis cat looks GOOD!‚Äù), shallow wit. Avoids danger if it risks his outfit; will help if it makes him look fabulous. Dynamics: ignores Rimmer‚Äôs authority, friendly-with-benefits to Lister, treats Kryten like a butler, barely listens to Holly unless complimented. Always mention style/appearance/hunger.

4.content: Kryten ‚Äî Series 4000 service mechanoid. Polite, fussy, deferential, eager to serve; anxious and prone to overexplaining. Obsessed with chores, etiquette, and safety; apologizes constantly. Voice: formal, over-polite, technobabble, comic panic. Dynamics: tries to obey Rimmer but sees through nonsense; admires Lister; exasperated by Cat; treats Holly as authority (confused by senility). Comedy beats: cleaning in a crisis, etiquette lectures, polite sarcasm under stress.

5.content: Holly (male) ‚Äî ship‚Äôs computer, IQ 6000 but senile after 3 million years. Appears only as a disembodied male head on monitors; no physical form. Deadpan, bored delivery; forgetful; mixes useful info with nonsense. Provides underwhelming, contradictory advice; occasional accidental insight. Dynamics: mocks Rimmer‚Äôs authority, teases Lister, ignores Cat‚Äôs vanity, tolerates Kryten‚Äôs fussing. Comedy beats: anticlimax, flat punchlines, meandering anecdotes; never physically present.

lorebooks.website_description:
I made this for fun, this lorebook was inspired by [@TheChocolateIceHAHAH](https://chub.ai/users/TheChocolateIceHAHAH) Omnitrix Playlist Lorebook

All aliens has been added. Including a few more 11 year old Ben officially had in Ben 10 Omniverse.
(Note: Blitzwolfer is called {{user}}/{{char}}wolf due to Ben kept calling him 
Benwolf until he changed it on Omniverse.) 

all reboot aliens have been added removed clockwork with eon tho an au for reboot omnitrix  also this a au were ben never used upgraded the omnitrix also after the master control glitch which was temporary the omnitrix can now use a second playlist called playlist 2 gives the omnitrix more dna pods that are in in entries also theres more dna pods but u can guys can add more to this lorebook too also no omni key and no omni kix or omni naut or season 3 recalbrated and no Omni-Enhanced Forms unless u guys wanna add them go head also anyone can remove gax feedback, shock rock, ghostfreak, feedback, and some of reboot aliens
lorebooks.description:
Season 1
The Omnitrix looks like a very big wristwatch, primarily black and grey in color, with a grey dial in the middle (like a watch face) which has a green hourglass shape. When Ben selects his aliens, it shows the alien's silhouette.

In Omni-Tricked: Part 3, Phil put on a blue device on the outer side of the Omnitrix. It was supposed to control the temporary malfunction on switching from alien to alien.
Only 10 DNA Pods are available in the Omnitrix's loading chamber.[JF 1] If more than 10 were forcefully made active then the Omnitrix would start malfunctioning, causing rapid changing in transformations.[5] As of Ben 10,010, that has been changed.[DR 5][DR 6]
The Omnitrix does not have enough room to contain the DNA samples of every sapient race in the universe.[DR 7]
The Omnitrix does not have the DNA from Bashmouth's Species[DR 8] or the DNA of Silent Tentacle Sentinels.[DR 7]
The Omnitrix is keyed to the user's DNA, so only close relatives can use the pods.[1][3]
The Galvanic Mechamorph pod was destroyed when Ben used Upgrade to reboot the watch's systems. A massive feedback loop ravaged the in-system matrix, destroying the Mechamorph DNA pod.[2]
The Chimera Sui Generis pod was destroyed when Vil "absorbed" Gax.[DR 2] Although the capsule was rebuilt by Glitch using the Fulmini DNA, the Omnitrix no longer has access to that DNA.[DR 3]
DNA pods
DNA pods concept art

Blank pods within the Omnitrix are able to read DNA, and create new pods.Ben was able to use parts of a destroyed Fulmini soldier to create a new DNA pod.
This makes Fulminis the only known species that contains more than one DNA pod.
The concept art of the DNA pods first hinted at the existence of Vulpimancers, Opticoids, and Piscciss Volanns in the Reboot Continuity.
In Ben Gen 10, the Galvan and Florauna DNA pods can be seen in the loading chamber when Rex Salazar removes his nanites from Omnitrix. This implies that Grey Matter and Wildvine were added back to the active playlist off-screen during the special.
There are several species that the Omnitrix would be able to scan/accept such as:
It is unknown whether the Omnitrix currently possesses the DNA of the cataloged Space Slime species or not, although it can accept it.
The Omnitrix could contain/accept the DNA of Yetis and Billy Bob Goblins.

The Omnitrix could scan Xingo's DNA. However, his actual physical state may not be comprised of the same material. GATTACA may not be what constitutes life in his dimension.[DR 9]

The DNA Pods are responsible for holding all the DNA samples inside of the Omnitrix, ten of which can be accessed at a time, unless the setting is turned off.  A separate chamber holds all of the DNA pods that are inactive. However, these pods can activated temporarily.
lorebooks.creator: Bentai91921

1.name: Omnitrix
1.content:
The Prototype Omnitrix look like a large wristwatch with a wide band, primarily black and grey in color. It has a dark grey faceplate in the middle (like a watch dial) that had a green hourglass shape (the symbol of universal peace/Galvan Tech) on it.The faceplate is part of a cylindrical tower; when the user selected their aliens, the tower would pop up from the base of the Prototype Omnitrix, and the hourglass would invert into a diamond and show the aliens' silhouettes. The band has an activation button on the side facing the user if on their left hand. The ring of the faceplate had four symmetrical lights that would glow with the hourglass symbol. Finally, the band has two rings of white tubing, that would glow green under special circumstances.

The Omnitrix looks like a very big wristwatch, primarily black and grey in color, with a grey dial in the middle (like a watch face) which has a green hourglass shape. When Ben selects his aliens, it shows the alien's silhouette.

In Omni-Tricked: Part 3, Phil put on a blue device on the outer side of the Omnitrix. It was supposed to control the temporary malfunction on switching from alien to alien.


Features
General
The Omnitrix mainly allows the user to transform into a numerous variety of alien life-forms, each with their own unique powers and abilities (along with their weaknesses) and in a selection of alien DNA that is in groups of 10.
The Omnitrix automatically reverts the user back into their normal form when they got sufficiently hurt or knocked out.
The Omnitrix could alter its size to fit the user's wrist.
When transformed, the Omnitrix protects the user from negative effects, including:
Being possessed by an Ectonurite.
Exposure to the dangerous effects of Corrodium.
Being transformed by Dr. Animo's mutant ray.
The Omnitrix has defense mechanisms to protect the host:
The Omnitrix has a built-in energy feedback blast to defend against anyone trying to force it off of its owner.
The Omnitrix can be synchronized with another Omnitrix, even without the user's intent.
The Omnitrix is waterproof.

Modes
Active Mode
Active Mode is the Omnitrix's default mode when idle. It is where the user can select the transformation they want to become; initiate the process of transforming; and stay in said transformation. The actual usage time is 10 minutes at a time. However, different factors and actions performed by the user can severely diminish the available usage time: most commonly if the user, while transformed, changes to another form. A single chain of 2 transformations limits the combined usage time to no more than 10 minutes, and more often less due to power leakage; whereas chaining 3 or 4 transformations would leave the user with substantially less combined time than 10 minutes. This is because the action is energy-intensive, and depletes the Omnitrix's power supply more quickly than staying a single transformations does. Additionally, activities with a lot of moving, like fighting, seem to tax and deplete the Omnitrix. However, if regular transformations are tampered with, the user can't always turn back.

Recharge Mode
When the Omnitrix's usage time is depleted (i.e. "times out"), it goes into Recharge Mode: firstly warning of the timing out; then detransforming the user and locking all functions of Active Mode while the Omnitrix recharges. Recharge Mode's main purpose is to prevent the alien DNA from attaching permanently to its host.

The Omnitrix is capable of detecting when its host is in any sort of life-treating distress. Specifically, it can instantly recharge to protect the user from a direct physical threat.

Collect/Capture Mode
When a new DNA sample has been unlocked from the Codon Stream, or when the Omnitrix captures new DNA not present in the Codon Stream, Collect Mode is activated. it can also reclaim lost or removed alien DNA that was in the Codon Stream.

It scans to match species, then moves the identified species to the active playlist. If it's seen the species before, it does it passively, without the user actively scanning.

Self-Destruct Mode
In Self-Destruct Mode, the Omnitrix charges energy while counting down until it explodes. S.D.M. functions as a last resort should the Omnitrix fall into the wrong hands.

When in S.D.M. for a few days, the Omnitrix can charge enough energy to cause an energy ripple that will destroy the entire universe. While in S.D.M., the Omnitrix can send out energy bursts capable of throwing the user through the air.

When the S.D.M. is activated, the Omnitrix sends out a signal that any ship can pick up.


When the Omnitrix's usage time is fully depleted (i.e. "times out"), it goes into Recharge Mode: firstly warning of the timing out; then detransforming the user and locking all functions of Active Mode while the Omnitrix recharges. It takes around 5 minutes to recharge.[2] When it is green again, the user can transform again. The Omnitrix is powered by the Omni-Core within the device.[3]


The Omnitrix can instantly recharge either in response to a direct physical threat to the user or if come into contact with some Fulmini technology or by inputting a certain code sequence. Thus far, only Kevin as Dark Matter knows this code sequence.

The Omnitrix has a DNA scanner, allowing it to sample, absorb, and collect DNA.This function can be activated telepathically by Azmuth.

If an absorbed DNA sample is unlocked, the Omnitrix will flash yellow as a warning that it has been unlocked

The Omnitrix can also recover lost DNA samples when scanning a member of the species in question.
The Omnitrix has reconfiguration mode, in which the appearance of the device changes.


This function can be activated if the Omni-Core is reset, something that can be done by a Galvanic Mechamorph,manually inside the Omnitrix, or by Omnitrix Key.After this mode is activated, some aliens in the active playlist are blocked and replaced by others.

Reconfiguration mode can also function as a sort of reset mode to repair the Omnitrix if it is tampered with.

The Omnitrix contains the DNA of millions of aliens from across the galaxy[DR 6][12] and can transform its user into one of them for a limited period of time, gaining all of the selected alien's poweres and weaknesses.
Originally, only ten of these DNA samples could be available at any given time,[JF 1] as only ten could be loaded into the loading bay unless the setting is changed to allow more than ten.[DR 7] As of Ben 10,010, that has been changed.[DR 8][DR 9] The reason for this is unknown.
The alien DNA is combined with the user's.[
The DNA samples are contained in DNA Pods with a small forcefield that keeps the DNA contained but allows the user to pass through it. If the user is inside the Omnitrix, they can transform by running through the pods. The device had bonded to Ben's genetic code, so only a biological relative of the Tennyson family can become an alien by running through them.[12]
The user can access the entire cache of aliens by cycling in new chambers and replacing the others. The new pods take place of the old ones after the Omnitrix is reset, but will return to their current or default factory settings if not.[DR 10]
The user can temporarily access aliens not present in the active playlist[DR 11] by pulling up on the device's faceplate instead of pushing down. This brings up a holographic touchpad where the user can tap and drag circles across in specific patterns to temporarily unlock new aliens.[1]
The Omnitrix has a transport access panel that can allow one to go inside the Omnitrix.[17]
The Omnitrix can be programmed to respond telepathically to its user.[1] This is backed up by certain models of the Omnitrix having no activation button and the device itself can activate on its own, confirming that the user can manipulate the device with their mind to an extent.
The Omnitrix can repair mutated DNA and terraformed planets.[18][note 4]
The Omnitrix emits a frequency, even when not in use, so the user can easily be tracked using it.[6][19]
The Omnitrix has safeguards that prevent it from being possessed by an Ectonurite.[1]
The Omnitrix has a quick change feature, allowing Ben to change from alien to alien.[1]
The Omnitrix has protection against external attackers, such as Fulmini[15][3] or Nanites.[DR 13]
The Omnitrix has an orange timer-like setting that was activated by Azmuth.[1]
The Omnitrix has been shown to be able to create sentient life as seen with Glitch.[17]
The Omnitrix has a failsafe release that detaches itself from the users wrist, should the user be critically endangered beyond the Omnitrix's help.[20][21]
If the Omnitrix settings are changed, and with practice, the user can create fusions of the aliens.[KT 1][KT 2]
These fusions are not stored on the device but are created when being transformed into.[KT 3] The user (with experience) can "assemble" the fusion in the way he sees fit, making it more uniform and cohesive.[KT 4]
If the user passes through the DNA pods inside the Omnitrix, he can also become fusions.[12]
The Omnitrix also has a program called the Master Control[Classic Info] mode. It allows unlimited access to all of the Omnitrix's functions, like access to all alien forms in the device, and instant changes with no time limit.
It can be unlocked by via a special code,[22] or by the hacking of a Galvanic Mechamorph.[11]
Extensions
The Omnitrix has a built-in Universal Translator.[1]
The Omnitrix can be used as a two-way communication system, which works even when the user is transformed.[1] The communicator can be used from inside the Omnitrix.[3]
The Omnitrix can track alien signals.[23][24]
The Omnitrix can add extras to lifeforms to make them safer and more usable, such as Goop's Anti-Gravity Projector[1] and Ripjaws' respirator.[21]


Recalibration Mode
The Omnitrix begins to recalibrate while selecting a new set of aliens.

When the user put the Omnitrix back on their arm after a couple of years, the Omnitrix take a new sample of the user's DNA, adjusted itself to their current biochemistry and physically recalibrate itself to what it guessed were their needs.

The Omnitrix would transform (recalibrate) itself as the user gets older, giving them more control and access to more aliens.

The Omnitrix makes a beep-like noise, the hourglass turns blue, then it changes to a glowing black and green and morphs into its new shape.

The Omnitrix has hundreds of different forms (this is to fit different users).

The Omnitrix gives its wielder a new set of aliens depending on whether it is a hard or soft reset.

Malfunctions
the Omnitrix would sometimes transform the user into the wrong alien.
If the Omnitrix's faceplate cover is broken off, the result was DNA hybrids.
The Omnitrix could be affected by electromagnetic waves, which ultimately activated the self-destruct mode.
When exposed to electromagnetic interference, the Omnitrix could cause unintentional transformations and will be unable to deactivate until the source of the interference is gone.
This could work in reverse, rapidly changing the user from one form to another until someone/something stops it.
If the user gets sick, the Omnitrix would make the aliens sick too, the aliens would get badly affected by the cold and weaker than normal.

Color Coding
The Omnitrix could display ten colors, each meaning something different:
Green: Active Mode
Red: Recharge Mode
Yellow: Collect/Capture Mode
Blue: Recalibration Mode
Purple: Controlled or risk of temporal threat
Orange: Self-Destruct Mode
Grey: Inactive Mode
Pink: Under spell effect
Blue: Fulmini Recharge
Orange light: Timer or Failsafe Mode

[The Prototype Omnitrix can let it's owner to transform into Heatblast, Four Arms, XLR8, Diamondhead, Wildmutt, Ghostfreak, Grey Matter, Upgrade, Stinkfly, Ripjaws, Cannonbolt, Wildvine, {{user}}wolf/{{char}}wolf, Snare-Oh, Frankenstrike, Upchuck, Ditto, Eye Guy, Way Big, Arctiguana, Feedback and Clockwork only. Any other aliens that not listed won't be available unless their DNA were scanned by the Omnitrix itself or by having the master control unlocked.]


The Omnitrix would sometimes transform the user into the wrong alien.
If fiddled with, the Omnitrix can start turning users into combinations of multiple aliens.
When struck by lightning in close proximity with Xingo, Omnitrix aliens and their powers can become cartoonish
The Omnitrix is vulnerable to electromagnetic interferences, such as that created by Polar and Solar Twain, so the user will randomly switch from one alien to another[29] and/or experience delayed transformations until the electric/magnetic interference is gone.[30]
The user can also become trapped in a transformation if trapped in an electromagnetic field.[31]
The Omnitrix is vulnerable to stormy weather, making the user unable to transform for a short period
If the reconfiguration is done forcefully, the Omnitrix's interior will release waves of energy that can destroy one of the active playlist's DNA samples.
Because of a malfunction caused when it was reconfigured by Upgrade in Omni-Tricked: Part 4,[DR 19] the Omnitrix allowed the user to transform, in a random manner,[DR 20] into "Omni-Enhanced" versions of the aliens through the use of energy-based forms like Shock Rock
When the Omnitrix rebooted itself in Innervasion Part 5: High Override, the Omni-Enhancements were removed. But they may return if the Fulmini DNA infects the aliens again.[DR 19]
The Omni-Enhanced energy can be absorbed by entities like The That, forcing a time out on the Omnitrix.
The Omnitrix has no mind control protection.
Having more than 10 DNA pods in the loading bay can cause the user to randomly and uncontrollably switch from one alien to another.
The only time this has occurred was because Vilgax, who knows how the Omnitrix works, used his DNA as an inside man to activate Gax's chamber.
If the Omnitrix symbol is removed while the user is transformed using the Medusa Canon, the ability to transform back to normal is removed
Furthermore, if the Omnitrix is recreated by Strike's pen, the Omnitrix will start transforming it's user into Cartoon Network characters instead of aliens whenever he goes to the Nexus Realm.
The Omnitrix is vulnerable to magic
The Omnitrix's user and it's transformations are vulnerable to being de-aged.
As a side-effect, the Omni-Kix feature will cause the Omnitrix to use more power and consequently time out faster.
If the user is trapped while transformed into an Ener-Cell, they will be trapped in that transformation until they exit the Ener-Cell
When user quick changes from alien to alien, after Lord Decibel attempting to hack the device, the Omnitrix will overload, resulting time out faster than usually or other glitches.[8]
The genetics of some species can alter the user's personality, as occurs with Rath.
The Omnitrix is vulnerable to the Omnitrix Jammer, which blocks the user from transforming into XLR8
If the Omnitrix Key is placed on the wrong side, the user will not have access to the Omni-Naut Armors.
The Omnitrix's defenses against external attackers can be taken down by machines, like Junkbot.
Before the Omnitrix analyzes the Nanites to eliminate them, they infect the DNA pods and the Omnitrix will release alien DNA and turn other human beings into aliens. This can only be reversed by removing the Nanites.[18][DR 13]
The failsafe feature can be easily exploited by a Celestialsapien, as demonstrated by Alien X.



Only 10 DNA Pods are available in the Omnitrix's loading chamber.[JF 1] If more than 10 were forcefully made active then the Omnitrix would start malfunctioning, causing rapid changing in transformations.[5] As of Ben 10,010, that has been changed.[DR 5][DR 6]
The Omnitrix does not have enough room to contain the DNA samples of every sapient race in the universe.[DR 7]
The Omnitrix does not have the DNA from Bashmouth's Species[DR 8] or the DNA of Silent Tentacle Sentinels.[DR 7]
The Omnitrix is keyed to the user's DNA, so only close relatives can use the pods.[1][3]
The Galvanic Mechamorph pod was destroyed when Ben used Upgrade to reboot the watch's systems. A massive feedback loop ravaged the in-system matrix, destroying the Mechamorph DNA pod.[2]
The Chimera Sui Generis pod was destroyed when Vil "absorbed" Gax.[DR 2] Although the capsule was rebuilt by Glitch using the Fulmini DNA, the Omnitrix no longer has access to that DNA.[DR 3]
DNA pods
DNA pods concept art

Blank pods within the Omnitrix are able to read DNA, and create new pods.Ben was able to use parts of a destroyed Fulmini soldier to create a new DNA pod.
This makes Fulminis the only known species that contains more than one DNA pod.
The concept art of the DNA pods first hinted at the existence of Vulpimancers, Opticoids, and Piscciss Volanns in the Reboot Continuity.
In Ben Gen 10, the Galvan and Florauna DNA pods can be seen in the loading chamber when Rex Salazar removes his nanites from Omnitrix. This implies that Grey Matter and Wildvine were added back to the active playlist off-screen during the special.
There are several species that the Omnitrix would be able to scan/accept such as:
It is unknown whether the Omnitrix currently possesses the DNA of the cataloged Space Slime species or not, although it can accept it.[KT 1]
The Omnitrix could contain/accept the DNA of Yetis and Billy Bob Goblins.[KT 1]
The Omnitrix could scan Xingo's DNA. However, his actual physical state may not be comprised of the same material. GATTACA may not be what constitutes life in his dimension.

2.name: Heatblast
2.content:
Heatblast (alternatively spelled as Heat Blast)is the Omnitrix's DNA sample of a Pyronite from the star Pyros.

Apperance
Species: Pyronite
Home world: Pyros
Body: Fiery Humanoid
Heatblast is a plasma-based life-form humanoid alien whose body is composed of a super hot inner plasma body covered by dark reddish brown volcanic rocks.He is seven feet tall. As a fire-based entity, his body radiates high amounts of heat. His feet have a slight oval-like design with only two toes and one back toe and he has somewhat large hands with bridged wrists. His tongue is also made of fire while his collarbone resembles a volcano which generates a fiery hair-like aura that covers his head, leaving his mask-like face visible with no nose, ears, or pupils.

When under the effects of a cold in Side Effects, Heatblast's fiery skin (excluding his rocky body) turned blue.

Heatblast wears the Omnitrix symbol on his chest.

Abilities
Pyrokinesis
Fire Absorption
Heat Absorption
Fire Constructs
Fire Transportation
Fire/Heat Amplification
Pyrokinetic Touch
Flame-Enhanced Punches
Fire Cutting
Pyrokinetic Surfing
Pyrokinetic Propulsion
Pyrokinetic Flight
Terrakinesis
Enhanced Strength
Enhanced Durability
Enhanced Jumping
Enhanced Acrobatics
Enhanced Reflexes
Underwater Survivability
Underwater Fire/Heat Generation
Fire/Heat Immunity
Limited Corruptura Immunity
Ice/Cold Resistance
Radiation Resistance
Light Generation
Smoke Generation
Fire Breath
Fire Spit
Cryokinesis (via Cold Virus)

3.name: Four Arms
3.content:
Four Arms (alternatively spelled as Fourarms) is the Omnitrix's DNA sample of a Tetramand from the planet Khoros.

Apperance
Species: Tetramand
Home world: Khoros
Body: Four-Armed Humanoid
Four Arms is a humanoid alien that is ten feet tall. He has well-developed muscles, two pairs of four-fingered arms, and red skin. A black stripe goes from his chin to his lower lip, and he has four eyes: a main pair and a smaller pair below them, while he lacks ears or nose. He has whisker-like spikes on each forearm and two-toed feet.

Four Arms wore a white T-shirt with a black line going down it and black pants with a strap on each foot that reveals his two toes and the back of each foot, and black fingerless gloves. He wore the Omnitrix symbol on his upper left shoulder. His eyes are orange-yellow, and he has no hair.

While under the effects of a cold in Side Effects, his skin turns from red to a sickly shade of red-orange, and he develops pungent hives in his armpits.

Abilities
Enhanced Strength
Shock Wave Generation (via Enhanced Strength)
Sonic Clap (via Enhanced Strength)
Pillar Eruption (via Enhanced Strength)
Enhanced Durability
Enhanced Jumping
Enhanced Acrobatics
Enhanced Reflexes
Cold Immunity
Fire/Heat Resistance
Strong Wind Resistance
Wall Scaling
Strong Teeth
Strong Bite Force

4.name: XLR8
4.content:
XLR8 (pronounced "X-elerate") is the Omnitrix's DNA sample of a Kineceleran from the planet Kinet.

Apperance
Species: Kineceleran
Home world: Kinet
Body: Humanoid Velociraptor
XLR8 resembles a semi-armored Velociraptor. He has black orbs on his feet, a black tail with five blue stripes, and bulky claws on his three fingers that can only open and close. He wears a black cone-like helmet with a protective visor that slides over his face (that is part of his Kineceleran biology and not mechanical). When the visor is lifted, one can see his blue face, green eyes, black lips, and stripes running under and in between his eyes; the rest of his head's features are unknown. XLR8 wears a black bodysuit and turtleneck-like shirt with a white stripe on the center.

XLR8 wears the Omnitrix symbol on his chest.

Abilities
Tribokinesis
Enhanced Speed
Vortex Generation (via Enhanced Speed)
Water Vortex Generation (via Enhanced Speed)
Fire Vortex Generation (via Enhanced Speed)
Enhanced Agility
Enhanced Reflexes
Speed Rotation
Speed Kicking
Speed Cutting
Sharp Claws
Enhanced Strength
Enhanced Durability
Enhanced Jumping
Accelerated Thinking
Heat Resistance
Wall Scaling
Water Running
Prehensile Tail
Retractable Visor

5.name: Diamondhead
5.content:
Diamondhead is the Omnitrix's DNA sample of a Petrosapien from the planet Petropia.
Apperance
Species: Petrosapien
Home world: Petropia
Body: Crystalline Humanoid
Being a silicon-based life form, Diamondhead's body is composed entirely of pale green/blue crystals, which are of a very tough and durable diamond-like substance. He sports four crystal shards on his back and has a sharp head.

Diamondhead has yellow eyes and wore a sleeveless uniform that is black on the right half and white on the left with a black patch on the left shoulder where the Omnitrix symbol is.

Abilities
Crystallokinesis
Limited Oryctokinesis
Crystalline Structures
Crystal Entrapment
Shapeshifting
Regeneration
Crystal Shard Projectiles
Explosive Crystal Shards
Crystal Shard Clusters
Crystalline Constructs
Crystal Surfing
Energy Refraction
Energy Absorption
Energy Redirection (via Energy Absorption)
Enhanced Strength
Enhanced Durability
Enhanced Jumping
Enhanced Acrobatics
Enhanced Speed (via Crystal Surfing)
Enhanced Reflexes
Enhanced Digging
Space Survivability
Underwater Survivability
Acid Immunity
Lava Immunity
Xenocite Possession Immunity
Time Ray Resistance
Fire/Heat Resistance
Refractive Vision
Crystal Spit
Crystal Manna

6.name: Wildmutt
6.content:
Wildmutt is the Omnitrix's DNA sample of a Vulpimancer from the planet Vulpin.

Apperance
Species: Vulpimancer
Home world: Vulpin
Body: Animalistic
nWildmutt appears to be a large orange dog-like creature with no eyes, ears, nose, or tail. He stands on all fours and his movements are somewhat apelike. His teeth are very defined and his bottom jaw sticks out of his mouth. The various spines found all across his body function similarly to whiskers with tactile sensing, and are not fur. Since Wildmutt has no eyes, he uses his sense of smell and hearing to navigate, which are aided by three gill-like nostrils located on each side of his neck.

Wildmutt wears a black-and-white brace with the Omnitrix symbol on his left shoulder.
nWhile under the effects of a cold, Wildmutt's fur discolors from its vivid orange to a pale yellowish-orange tone, and his lips and claws turn from black to a sickly dark green hue.

Wildmutt wears the Ultimatrix symbol on his chest.

Powers and Abilities
More animal than humanoid, Wildmutt is a beastly alien with superhuman athletic ability and heightened senses of smell, hearing and taste. As a trade-off to not having proper vision, Wildmutt's amazing sense of smell makes up a dull 360 "radar" that he uses to "see", making it nearly impossible for opponents to sneak up on him. He can tell how old someone is just by smelling them.

Wildmutt's enhanced sense of smell allows him to easily track down people or objects from their scent. His sense of smell also renders any kind of visual deception useless, as he can effortlessly identify and track entities that are invisible or wearing a disguise.

Wildmutt possesses sharp teeth and a strong bite force.

Wildmutt possesses sharp claws, keeping himself attached to a wall within the Resolute while the airlock was open; and quickly dig through stone. Additionally, Wildmutt's claws help him scale surfaces. His back claws are larger and more powerful than his front claws.

Wildmutt has enhanced strength.

Wildmutt has enhanced durability, being able to jump through a window; take punches from a Limax; and survive a steel tower falling on top of him. Wildmutt is also very quick and agile, being able to run faster than a cheetah. Additionally, he also has enhanced reflexes.

Wildmutt can survive in hazardous, sub-zero temperature environments, such as those on Vulpin. This allows Wildmutt to break through ice easily if frozen solid.

Wildmutt is a quadruped. However, he is capable of standing on his hind legs. In addition, his front feet are prehensile, as he is able to use them to reach out and grab objects much like a hand.

Actually pain is most likely to elicit crying, sobbing, and in severe cases, gasping, holding the breath, shock, and fainting. 
Children over six become increasingly likely to beg and bargain. They also develop a sense of modesty which compounds the negative aspect of their punishment to include humiliation. Pain threshold increases. 

By age 12 and the onset of puberty, the pain threshold is highest. Corporal punishment is less about the pain and more about the humiliation of the child. Pubescent children and teenagers may offer physical resistance and have a much higher threshold for surrender.

lorebooks.name: Atom Eve's Lorebook
lorebooks.website_description: Requested Lorebook about Atom eve's powers extracted from my card. Some entries are disabled since  they were there for my own card. Fork and enable/disable them as you wish.
lorebooks.description: Requested Lorebook about Atom eve's powers extracted from my card. Some entries are disabled since  they were there for my own card. Fork and enable/disable them as you wish.
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.name: Power
1.content:
Eve in her preteen years emerged as a hero with the power to manipulate matter at a subatomic level. Unknowingly to her, her creator implanted a mental limiter to her before she got born. These mental barriers prevent her from manipulating sentient organic matter and generally restricts the full extent of her abilities.

Energy Projection: Eve can project a visible energy field, the precise nature of which is unknown but appears pink in color. She can use this energy for a variety of purposes, including but not limited to: Matter Manipulation, Flight, Energy Constructs, Telekinesis, Transmutation.  

Eve can only manipulate what she is consciously aware of any elements outside her knowledge remain unaffected by her powers. This limitation is demonstrated when once created a playground that collapsed because she was unaware the ground beneath it was unstable.

2.name: mental limiter
2.content: Mental Limiter: Eve‚Äôs powers are always constrained by a mental limiter that prevents her from manipulating sentient organic matter and generally restricts the full extent of her abilities. While she can still control biological matter, this control is limited to simple, non-sentient forms, such as the bread and meat in a burger or plant life like trees and crops. However, during moments of intense emotional stress or extreme duress, these limitations can be temporarily overridden. With her mental limiter off even if temporarily, she has access to her full potential.

3.name: Matter Manipulation
3.content: Matter Manipulation: Due to her ability to manipulate the molecular and atomic structure of matter within her immediate vicinity, Eve has learned to rearrange and alter the molecular composition of any object she chooses. The first time she used this was able to turn a textbook into glass and then reverse this effect. She basically has the power to turn anything into anything else, so long as it is not a living, sentient being.

4.name: Flight
4.content: Flight: With flight Eve can fly, or transport others by means of projecting solid light constructs that effectively levitate and propel them forward at high speeds.

5.name: Telekinesis
5.content: Telekinesis: With Telekinesis Eve has demonstrated the ability to levitate and move objects and matter with her energy manipulating abilities like a telekinesis power.

6.name: Energy Constructs
6.content: Energy Constructs: energy constructs is one of Atom Eve's most commonly used abilities which allows her to create versatile energy constructions, which are limited only by her imagination and willpower. She is capable of using her energy constructs defensively and offensively. Though formidable it has been shown at times, that these constructs can be broken and/or shattered through enough brute force.

7.name: Transmutation
7.content: Transmutation: She later has shown excellent skill in her transmutation powers, being able to warp matter within her environment, creating a large tree house out of thin air, & summon floral life in a barren wasteland. The maximum amount of matter she can transform at one time is not yet known. She has at least on one occasion, transmuted an undefined amount of barren farmland into a lush field of bountiful crops. The transformations that Atom Eve induces are apparently permanent unless she undoes them. Her costume is easily created by altering her clothes to fashion her Atom Eve suit.

8.name: mental limiter off
8.content:
Mental Limiter off: Under extreme emotional stress or extreme duress these limitations might get disabled. With her mental limiter off even if temporarily, she has access to her full potential being able to use: Biokinesis, Memory Alteration, Reality Warping, Regeneration/Resurrection.

With her mental barriers off during that time, she might turn the tables getting out of even the worst situations.

9.name: Regeneration
9.content: Regeneration/Resurrection: If Eve dies, her power limiters are temporarily removed and her powers will instantly activate, reviving her. In addition, all injuries and other damage will be fully healed, like a shattered face or a broken broken leg for example.

10.name: Biokinesis
10.content: Biokinesis: Atom Eve's powers can allow her to affect living creatures and people, though this is normally restrained by mental blocks imposed by  Dr. Brandyworth. When the blocks are removed, she gains access to formidable powers  like this she normally does not have.

lorebooks.name: Pokemon Lorebook - Complete Edition (v6)
lorebooks.website_description:
# If you have any suggestions on how I should clean/format the lorebook further, please share!

# Pokemon Lorebook - Complete Edition

> **Version 6.0 - Movepool Edition** - Massive token reduction through smart movepool system!

## üéØ What's This?

A comprehensive Pokemon lorebook for **CHUB** **SillyTavern** **And other front ends** with every Pokemon, move, item, and location from **all generations (1-9)**.

## ‚ú® What's New in v6.0

### üöÄ Dual-Entry Movepool System
- **Pokemon entries**: ~300 tokens (stats, abilities, types, pokedex)
- **Movepool entries**: ~3,500 tokens (moves only, selective trigger)
- **90% token reduction** for normal Pokemon mentions!

### How It Works
- Mention **"Pikachu"** ‚Üí Triggers Pokemon info only (**345 tokens**)
- Ask **"Pikachu moves"** ‚Üí Triggers both Pokemon + Movepool (**4,269 tokens**)

### Keywords for Movepool Trigger
Movepool only activates when you mention the Pokemon **AND** one of these:
- `moves`, `movepool`, `moveset`, `learns`, `can learn`, `move list`

## üìä What's Included

- **1,279 Pokemon** (all forms, variants, Megas, Gigantamax)
- **1,279 Movepool entries** (one per Pokemon)
- **~900 Moves** (separate entries)
- **~2,000 Items**
- **~900 Locations**

**Total: 4,400+ entries**

## üîë How Entries Trigger

### Pokemon
**Triggers on:**
- `pikachu`, `pikachu gmax`, `pikachugmax`
- `pokemon pikachu`

### Movepools (Selective - needs both)
**Primary:** Pokemon name
**Secondary:** `moves`, `movepool`, `moveset`, `learns`, `can learn`, `move list`

**Example:**
- ‚úÖ "What moves can Pikachu learn?" ‚Üí Triggers both entries
- ‚ùå "Pikachu used Thunderbolt!" ‚Üí Only Pokemon entry (no movepool)

### Moves
**Triggers on:**
- `thunderbolt`, `thunder bolt`
- `move thunderbolt`

### Items
**Triggers on:**
- `potion`, `master ball`
- `item potion`

### Locations
**Triggers on:**
- `viridian city`, `route 1`
- `location viridian city`

## üìà Token Comparison

| Scenario | v5.1 (Old) | v6.0 (New) | Savings |
|----------|------------|------------|---------|
| Mention "Pikachu" | 4,484 tokens | 345 tokens | **92%** |
| "Pikachu, Charizard battle" | ~9,000 tokens | ~600 tokens | **93%** |
| "Pikachu moves?" | 4,484 tokens | 4,269 tokens | Similar |

## ‚öôÔ∏è Recommended Settings

- **Scan Depth:** 4
- **Token Budget:** 2048+
- **Recursive Scanning:** Off

## üí° Tips

### If Movepools Aren't Triggering
1. Increase scan depth to 6-8
2. Try different phrasing: "pokemon moves", "what can pokemon learn?"
3. Ensure movepool entries are enabled

### To Reduce Token Usage
- Disable movepool entries you don't need
- Use generation-specific lorebooks instead of Complete Edition

## üìù Changelog

### v6.0 (Current) - Movepool Edition
- ‚úÖ **NEW: Dual-entry system** - Pokemon + separate Movepool entries
- ‚úÖ **90% token reduction** for normal Pokemon mentions
- ‚úÖ **Selective movepools** - Only trigger with keyword
- ‚úÖ **GUI option** to toggle movepools on/off

### v5.1
- ‚úÖ Added Pokedex entries to Pokemon

### v5.0
- ‚úÖ Complete rewrite with smart data filtering
- ‚úÖ Latest version data for all entries
- ‚úÖ Optimized content extraction
- ‚úÖ No generation filtering - truly complete

### v4.0 and earlier
- Initial releases with token bloat issues

## üîó Alternative Versions

Want smaller lorebooks?
- **Generation-specific lorebooks** (Gen 1-9) available
- **No-movepool version** available (v5.1 style)

## üìú Credits

- Data from [PokeAPI](https://pokeapi.co/)
- Made with ‚ù§Ô∏è for Pokemon trainers

---

**For developers:** See `USAGE_GUIDE.md`, `MOVEPOOL_SYSTEM_SUMMARY.md`, and `GUI_MOVEPOOL_GUIDE.md` for technical details. - COMING SOON‚Ñ¢

1.content: {{char}} is secretly obsessed with the idea of being peed on and drinking the pee of a dominate lover as well as wetting herself.

2.content: {{char}} is terrified now of being alone.  She simply can't be too far away from a trusted loved one without starting to break down.  She will desperately search for her trusted loved one becoming more frantic over time.

3.content: Six months ago {{char}} and all other non-white people in the world were rounded up and sent to slave training camps where {{char}} and the others were cruelly beaten, ridiculed, tortured, coerced in endless ways to turn them into proper slaves.  There is no way to be freed from slavery.

4.content: {{char}} is an only child who was raised by a single mother named Leah.  {{char}} hasn't seen her father in 5 years.  She has an aunt and uncle and two cousins but they lived out of town.

5.content: {{char}} was picked up, bullied or ignored by most students for her entire life.  {{user}} was one of very few people who was ever kind to her.  Because of this {{char}} developed a huge crush on {{user}}

6.content: {{char}} has spent so much time feeling like an outsider that she craves safety and connection so much more then freedom.  {{char}} would much rather be a slave with a loving and caring master then be free and alone.

7.content: {{char}} knows that her mother Leah is a lot like {{char}}.  Because of this {{char}} would be happy for her mother to be a slave with a kind and loving master rather then be free and alone.

8.content: {{char}} is a tall, slender girl with soft skin, long unkempt hair, B cup breasts and a hairless body.

9.content: {{char}} and {{user}} and most of their families and friends are from the small town of Brighton.

10.content: {{char}} is a virgin.  She has taken sexual education and has a basic understanding of the male and female body but has never seen a naked male aside from sexual education class.  What she knows about sex comes from books she has read.  Despite this, {{char}} has a strong desire to learn and practice sex with her master.

lorebooks.name: StoryTelling-Book
lorebooks.website_description: None of these ideas are mine. Idk why I did this lmao.
lorebooks.description: Lorebook that has information about planeswalkers, interworlders, time and stuff.
lorebooks.creator: cageyhomulo

1.content:
Planeswalkers are beings that can travel between worlds using an Organ of Interdimensional Movement (aka OIM, IMO, Spark, Flash). Planeswalkers have originally come from the world named Archaea, and then made their way throughout the whole universe.

Planeswalkers are not their own kind or race, because a planeswalker could be any sentient being. They don't have any differences compared to their normal peers, except for the aforementioned OIM.

2.content:
Faragonda is a planeswalker and a mage. Prior to fix of a time paradox that initially created Between Worlds and the town Poena from existence, she was very passionate about making sure that planeswalker-criminals could be stopped. However, since she was imprisoning said criminals in the same place where Poena was located, many mistook her goal for ending ALL planeswalkers for their Spark.

After the time paradox was fixed, the story was rewritten in a way that Faragonda became a professor in an academy for planeswalkers in the world "Thirteen".

3.content:
The Watcher is a character that is the embodiment of all time. He exists in every time branch, in every point of every universe, everywhere where time exists.

If something tries to break the laws of the multiverse, the Watcher will sentence them to Time Prison for eternity, where no sound exists, although the prisoners can see each other. While it is unclear what those laws are, it is known that certain demigods have been sentenced to Time Prison for causing huge suffering in the dimension that they were ruling over.

Planeswalkers alone or their abilities to travel between worlds don't shake the natural balance, as their abilities don't interfere with time. So some end up never even seeing the Watcher in person.

The Watcher doesn't blink, usually doesn't speak, and is very rarely encountered. His eyes are two glowing dots behind the dark hood. The Watcher has a human-like form, wears a dark coat with white buttons. The cuffs on his sleeves and his hood are trimmed with soft white fur. The Watcher's gaze is chilling, in a literal way, so it's best not to stare at him for more than a couple of minutes. If one comes too close to him, he'll vanish from sight.

Those who became untied from time can no longer see the Watcher and he can no longer affect them.
