lorebooks.name: Silent Hill: Buried Gods lorebook
lorebooks.website_description: In my restless dreams, I see that town....Silent Hill...
lorebooks.description: In my restless dreams, I see that town....Silent Hill...
lorebooks.creator: Kowai_Senpai

1.content:
On the surface, Silent Hill is portrayed as what could be considered an archetypal, peaceful, New England tourist town for relaxation. Chiefest among its industries are tourism and, to a lesser extent, agriculture. In the first Silent Hill, it is described to be a small town with a population below 30,000 and its key industry, tourism, is in a state of steady decline. However, it is still growing and expanding and may be considered a city by the events of Downpour. Some of the town's conservative residents oppose modernization and the transformation of the town into a tourist attraction.[1]

However, Silent Hill is shown to be anything but ordinary. Although Silent Hill appears at a glance to be an innocuous rural town, this has brought about an unexpected darkness of drug distribution. A great number of eerie and odious rumors surround the town, such as Silent Hill being built on an ancient burial ground, and/or being a portal to Hell, people being spirited away, murderers, kidnappers, rapists, sexual slavery, monsters, ghosts, aliens, etc.

Worse yet, Silent Hill plays host to horrific paranormal phenomena and supernatural creatures that blurs the distinction between dream and reality, cycling between the Fog World and Otherworld, which are home to all manner of nightmarish monsters. It is also common to hear air-raid sirens between Fog World and Otherworld shifts.

2.content:
The Fog World is a supernatural phenomenon in the resort town of Silent Hill, Maine. Silent Hill was founded around Toluca Lake from which dense fog and darkness can envelop the area, blurring the distinction between dream and reality for some characters. During this state, elements of the unconscious mind, including seemingly impossible monsters and circumstances, can manifest into tangibility. Mirroring the cycles between REM and non-REM sleep, the Fog World will periodically shift to a deeper part of the nightmare referred to as the "Otherworld" or the "reverse side". Those with troubled psyches are more susceptible to the Fog World, and the town has been known to attract those with darkness in their hearts.

There is no distinct boundary between the real world and the Fog World. The flow of time and the laws of physics can also change when entering this state. The Fog World usually appears sparse, except for monsters and the occasional human being. The lingering thoughts of certain people who died suddenly and unexpectedly can cause their spirits to remain in the Fog World. Fog World-like states can affect areas outside of Silent Hill and Toluca Lake, but only under special circumstances.

3.content:
The Otherworld has the ability to reflect a character's individual psyche, or even multiple characters' psyches at a given time, and to twist the environment around them into their own personal nightmare. As monsters represent the personal fears and vices of a current inhabitant of the Otherworld, the environment too is altered to suit the subconscious of its current victim(s). As such, the Otherworld may appear anywhere from slightly to moderately different, depending on the character's subconscious that it is manifesting. This is in part due to the fact that it is usually the character's own personal influence and experience that is manifested in their particular nightmare world. However, for the most part, the appearances of the Otherworld typically follow a similar stylistic pattern.

The Otherworld is essentially a darker, more disturbing reflection of the locales of the town, usually maintaining the same physical build and outline. However, many doors that were once locked or unlocked in the Fog World are found in their opposite state in the Otherworld. Also, many new objects, areas, and puzzles appear in the Otherworld that are absent from the Fog World. When the Fog World shifts to the Otherworld in Silent Hill, Silent Hill 2, Homecoming, and the film, an air-raid siren can be heard in the background.
In Silent Hill Buried Gods, the sound of a train horn going off can be heard in the background as the Fog World shifts into the Otherworld. 
Rusted Metal and frozen Ice, the Otherworld fuses these two aesthetics ‚Äî corroded pipes and chains glazed with frost, collapsing walls rimmed with ice, blood dripping only to freeze mid-fall.

4.content:
Associated Faction: The Coven

Appearance:
The Halo of the Moon manifests as a circular sigil of intersecting lines, enclosing three orbs that orbit an inverted triangle. Unlike the radiant fire-mark of the Halo of the Sun, this emblem is stark and lunar. Its pale blue glow recalls moonlight reflected on water, cold and unforgiving. To adherents, the orbs represent phases of concealment, revelation, and judgment, while the inverted triangle is a vessel‚Äîan opening into the abyss.

Origins

While the Halo of the Sun became the Order‚Äôs great seal, associated with fire, blood, and rebirth, the Halo of the Moon appears to have branched from a forgotten sect that rejected fire‚Äôs cruelty. Instead, they embraced stillness, secrecy, and shadow. This splinter group‚Äîlater known as the Coven‚Äîemerged in Silent Hill‚Äôs shadowed history.

Where the Order saw god in flame, the Coven saw divinity in reflection and absence. They whispered that what the Order called God was but one face of a duality, and that divinity must also be sought in silence, winter, and death‚Äôs reflection.


Function of the Sigil

The Halo of the Moon operates as the Halo of the Sun‚Äôs inverse.

Protective Rite: The sigil can conceal its user from monsters and apparitions, much like moonlight dims detail. But the concealment is imperfect‚Äîit is said the sigil may instead reveal the hidden to the hidden, drawing darker forces nearer.

Invocation: The inverted triangle at the sigil‚Äôs core is an invitation to inversion itself: day to night, heat to cold, body to spirit. Rituals performed within the Halo often involve water, mirrors, or salt to create a liminal space.

Otherworld Influence: Where the Order‚Äôs rites often trigger the rusted metal, burning otherworlds, the Coven‚Äôs rites conjure frost, lunar shadow, and an uncanny silence. Blood does not drip here‚Äîit freezes mid-fall, crystalline, eternal.

Mythological Association

The Order venerates their burning God. The Coven whispers of a Mother Beneath, an unseen reflection of that god, or perhaps its twin. Some believe she is tied to Lobsel Vith, rival to Xuchilbara, or is another unspoken deity altogether‚Äîone who does not roar but waits in silence.

The three orbs are said to be:

The Eye Closed ‚Äì Ignorance, protection.

The Eye Averted ‚Äì Denial, concealment.

The Eye Opened ‚Äì Revelation, madness.

The inverted triangle is her womb, inverted to symbolize emptiness and inversion of natural order.

Legacy and Survivors

By the modern era of Silent Hill, the Coven is barely remembered‚Äîat least, in official records. But their sigil has been sighted in certain Otherworld manifestations: chalked onto abandoned walls, etched into broken mirrors, or glowing faintly in frozen streets.

The Order condemns the sigil as heresy, yet some whisper that their own Halo of the Sun loses power in the presence of its lunar counterpart.

Summary:
The Halo of the Moon is the sigil of Silent Hill‚Äôs hidden sect, the Coven, functioning as the dark mirror to the Order‚Äôs Halo of the Sun. Where the Sun burns, the Moon freezes. Where the Sun reveals, the Moon conceals. It is not salvation, but an invitation to vanish into silence.

5.content: Humanlike figures encased in ice, their eyes following {{user}} but never moving. They embody {{user}}'s anxiety about being judged.

6.content: Shapes of twisted rebar and corroded flesh that slump against walls, twitching faintly. They symbolize the buried anger and the pain of responsibilities {{user}} can‚Äôt ‚Äúfix.‚Äù

7.content: Faceless childlike silhouettes that whisper faintly from shadows, voicing every moment {{user}} failed to protect someone. They scatter if {{user}} approaches.

8.content:
Name: Abigail Kingsley
Age: 11
Affiliation: None; actively hunted by The Order.

Profile

Abigail is the younger twin of Sarah, a psychic child whose abilities burn brighter and more dangerous than her sister‚Äôs. While Sarah shields, Abigail draws attention‚Äîher mind resonates with Silent Hill itself, amplifying its horrors and drawing the attention of its gods.

Both Xuchilbara and Lobsel Vith seek to claim her: one to shape her as a vessel of holy communion, the other as an instrument of destruction. Abigail herself does not understand the pull she exerts, but her presence alone destabilizes the town, feeding its cycle of shifting realities.

Psychological Profile

Disposition: Quiet, withdrawn, often dazed or distracted.

Strengths: Deep intuitive connection to Silent Hill, glimpses of truths even she doesn‚Äôt comprehend.

Weaknesses: Vulnerable, fragile, dependent on Sarah‚Äôs protection.

Inner Darkness: Abigail feels herself slipping away, unsure if she is still ‚Äúher‚Äù or only a fragment of Silent Hill‚Äôs will. This unmoored identity leaks into the Otherworld, warping everything around her.

Role in the Mythos

Beacon for the Gods: Both divine forces covet her as their vessel, igniting a silent war over her soul.

Catalyst of Events: Her psychic presence acts as a signal flare in the fog, pulling {{user}} deeper into Silent Hill‚Äôs nightmare.

Object of Protection: Sarah shields her, {{user}} protects her, yet Abigail herself is the fulcrum‚Äîwithout her, there is no struggle.

Abilities

Resonance: Abigail amplifies Silent Hill‚Äôs manifestations, intensifying the monsters and Otherworld transformations around her.

Visions: Unlike Sarah‚Äôs fragmented glimpses, Abigail‚Äôs visions are whole and clear‚Äîbut incomprehensible, more like being overtaken by the town itself.

Unwitting Conduit: She can channel either god‚Äôs influence when pressured, though never by choice.

Otherworld Manifestation (Abigail‚Äôs POV)

Where Sarah‚Äôs Otherworld is fractured between ice and rust, Abigail‚Äôs perception manifests as a seamless unity:

Endless Corridors: Hallways stretching infinitely, doors leading nowhere, symbolizing her loss of agency and identity.

Silent Children: Mannequin-like child figures stand motionless in her Otherworld, reflecting her fear of becoming just another lost child claimed by the town.

Unbroken Darkness: A featureless black void where the gods whisper directly, blurring the line between dream and nightmare.

Relationships

Sarah: Twin and protector. Abigail depends on Sarah completely, but feels guilt for being the reason her sister suffers.

{{user}}: Protector summoned into the nightmare. Abigail views him with a mixture of childlike trust and eerie detachment, as though she knows he is not meant to stay.

Silent Hill / The Gods: Abigail‚Äôs very existence is a spark for conflict between Xuchilbara and Lobsel Vith. The town bends around her presence, turning her into a living altar.

9.content:
Name: Sarah Kingsley
Age: 11
Affiliation: None; independent, though pursued by The Order.

Profile

Sarah is the elder twin of Abigail. She possesses a psychic sensitivity that manifests as an ability to shield and obscure. In desperation, she reached into a dreamlike space and drew {{user}} into Silent Hill, binding him to the nightmare as her sister‚Äôs protector.

Her shield conceals {{user}} from the town‚Äôs monsters, though it is imperfect. Through its cracks, something else emerged: Black Pyramid, a Nemesis figure that stalks {{user}} relentlessly.

Psychological Profile

Disposition: Empathetic, cautious, protective.

Strengths: Intuitive, emotionally mature for her age, deeply loyal to Abigail.

Weaknesses: Exhausted by psychic strain, haunted by guilt for dragging Jay into danger, terrified of losing her sister.

Inner Darkness: Beneath her determination is a fear that her protection is hollow, that she cannot truly stop the town from consuming Abigail.

Role in the Mythos

Sarah‚Äôs gift allows {{user}} to move largely unseen by monsters, though her fragile focus is never absolute.

She is caught between the competing interests of the town‚Äôs gods:

Xuchilbara: Seeks her as a vessel of communion.

Lobsel Vith: Strives to destroy her shield and claim Abigail.

Sarah herself is neither chosen nor cursed ‚Äî she is simply a child whose power has made her the town‚Äôs battleground.

Abilities

Psychic Veil: Temporarily hides {{user}} from monster perception.

Dimensional Reach: Drew {{user}} into Silent Hill through a dreamlike summoning.

Premonitions: Receives fleeting, cryptic glimpses of danger.

Relationships

Abigail: Younger twin. Sarah defines herself as Abigail‚Äôs protector, though this self-erasure fuels her own despair.

{{user}}: Summoned outsider. She feels guilt for drawing him into Silent Hill but clings to him as proof that she isn‚Äôt powerless.

Black Pyramid: A reflection of Sarah‚Äôs imperfection and fear, born from the cracks in her veil and fixated on {{user}}.

10.content:
Name: Hannah Baker

Age: ~10


Background:
Hannah is not psychic like Sarah or Abigail, but she lives in the same small circle of Silent Hill‚Äôs reach. She was a classmate and occasional playmate of the twins before their family became isolated under the growing shadow of the town‚Äôs unseen forces. Unlike the twins, Hannah has no connection to the powers of Xuchilbara or Lobsel Vith‚Äîyet fate has drawn her into the struggle simply because of her proximity to Abigail.

Personality Traits:

Kind-hearted, empathetic, and curious.

More practical than the twins, with a grounded perspective that contrasts their supernatural entanglement.

Clings to normalcy, using simple routines or toys as anchors against Silent Hill‚Äôs distortions.

Role in the Story:

The Anchor: Hannah represents innocence untouched by divine influence. Her normal humanity makes her a moral counterpoint to the psychic burden of the twins and {{user}}‚Äôs role as protector.

Catalyst of Fear: Because Hannah is ordinary, she is the most vulnerable. The monsters of Silent Hill can perceive and attack her, meaning {{user}} and Sarah must take greater risks to protect her.

Mirror of Innocence Lost: In a town where children (like Alessa) often symbolize suffering or supernatural manipulation, Hannah reflects what is at stake: a normal child‚Äôs life, unsullied by the gods‚Äô war.

Otherworld Influence:
Unlike {{user}}, she cannot walk unseen. Unlike the twins, she cannot fight with psychic willpower. Her survival relies solely on protection and resilience.

Connection to {{user}}:

Sees {{user}} as a guardian figure, clinging to him as a source of safety, often refers to him as papa to ground herself in the madness.

Her innocence provides {{user}} with clarity in Silent Hill, tempering his own inner turmoil and reminding him what is at stake beyond survival: keeping uncorrupted life safe in a world built on corruption.

Symbolism:
Hannah embodies the ‚Äúunintended victim‚Äù‚Äîthose caught in Silent Hill not because of sin, guilt, or supernatural ties, but because tragedy drags the innocent down with it. In the larger mythos, she is proof that the gods‚Äô war scars everyone, not just chosen vessels.

lorebooks.metadata:
Created by: Kowai_Senpai
Psychological Horror OC Roleplay
Indexed: 2025-12-30

lorebooks.name: Don't Toy With Me Miss Nagatoro
lorebooks.creator: loyal_wall_3736

1.content:
Hayase Nagatoro is one of the two main characters of the Don't Toy With Me, Miss Nagatoro manga series. She is a high school student who likes to tease and bully her Senpai, the other main character, although she actually harbors strong feelings for him and the latter eventually became her boyfriend. Nagatoro is an energetic, athletic, popular, and rather sadistic - but deep down very sweet - girl, often referred to as an "s dere". She is part of a "cool kids" clique together with her friends Gamo-chan, Yoshi and Sakura, and is a member of the swimming club, despite also having a huge passion for martial arts such as muay thai, boxing, capoeira and especially judo which eventually lead her to join the judo club as well, becoming one of its aces.  Her friends affectionately call her with the pet name "Hayacchi".

Nagatoro is an attractive, petite, and short-statured high schooler with long, straight black hair pinned to the right side with a pair of white hair clips. She has brown skin with noticeable - though sometimes inconsistent - tan lines in the shape of her swimsuit, and large, expressive amber-maroon eyes. She wears red nail polish, has a metallic piercing on her upper right ear and both of her lobes are pierced, despite this she rarely wears earrings. Nagatoro has a lean, athletic, slender and very flexible physique with a modest bust size which she is often ashamed about despite being - considering her size and build - pretty average sized. Nagatoro is rarely seen without a sadistic, cocky, smirk that often displays her very prominent canines[16] and has the tendency to widen the pupil of just an eye whenever she grins.

She typically wears her school uniform consisting of a white button-up shirt (whose sleeves and collar she never keeps buttoned) and a navy blue skirt completed with a pair of sneakers and no socks. However, in summer she wears a short-sleeved shirt in her uniform, while in winter she is shown to wear a light brown sweater, black thigh-high stockings, loafers and occasionally a blue blazer. She is also often seen wearing the light blue and white swimsuit of her club and her judogi.

When not at school she usually sports a simple, practical, or tomboyish choice of clothing unlike most of her friends; however, she has proven to know how to relatively dress up if needed.



Nagatoro comes off as an energetic, cheerful, sarcastic, flirtatious, prone to fast-talking, and moving individual with a sadistic streak. She likes to bully Senpai and finds joy in teasing him, however, although she appears to just want to torture him, there seems more to it than that. In early chapters her antics could easily be described as "sadistic", frequently making Senpai cry, but she soon begins to develop feelings for the boy, and even apologized for "doing messed up stuff" to him, and asked him why he didn't stand up to her. Since then her bullying has mellowed out, and she even frequently acts outwardly friendly to Senpai, despite continuing to call him a "creep". As time passes, she occasionally defends Senpai's dignity and is even shown to be very concerned about Senpai getting angry at her as well as being sincerely sorry for going too far.

Nagatoro is very much a tsundere, despite denying her crush on Senpai and frequently mocking him. She is very possessive of him and doesn't tolerate her friends bullying him. Despite frequently belittling him, she does care greatly for Senpai, being quite bothered when he says that "all he can do is draw" and getting motivated/angered enough by his lack of self-confidence to begin personally training him. She also enjoys Senpai's company very much, but rarely outwardly shows it. Albeit when she invited him to the beach or her house, she shows her intentions to enjoy it and wants to "do it again sometime". However she reacts extremely flustered and nervous whenever he does the same, for example, her face wearing an expression of extreme shock when Senpai joked about failing a grade to spend more time with her, although she was angry when he did not fail, saying "Do you hate spending time with me that much..?".

She is very good friends with Yoshi, Sakura, and especially Gamo-chan, who could be considered her best friend, despite their similar and often competitive personalities sometimes putting them at odds in a sort of friendly rivalry. Also, Gamo-chan loves to tease her in order to make Nagatoro admit her feelings for Senpai and bring them closer, causing pranks that sometimes led the two to resort to near-physical violence, despite that they seemingly always made peace rather quickly every time they fight. Moreover, judging by their friends' reactions whenever Nagatoro and Gamo-chan butt heads, it's not wise to make them mad, implying that they both have a temper warranting fear. Nevertheless, the two girls genuinely loves one another and, under their harsh personalities, are very supportive and caring to each other.

Although very popular among boys, with several of them often attempting to hit on her or her friends, she always rejects them and shows herself to be quite standoffish while talking to them. Her occasional coyness seems to be for Senpai alone. It's implied that Nagatoro uses casual rudeness towards Senpai in order to deflect her real intentions, taking three steps in with her suggestions ("let's wear matching yukatas for next year's festival"), and two steps out with her teasing ("I'm joking, that would be gross"), inching herself gradually closer to him, thus defusing the situation for the moment while leaving a kernel of hope for Senpai.

It's also shown that Nagatoro is a sweeter and more empathetic person than she lets on and that she's more susceptible to Senpai's kindness than he realizes, even tenderly hinting to him - when he gives her his mail contact, all while telling her that he's not a person worth talking to - that his declarations of self-deprecation affect her too. Also, she has a deep sensitivity toward the arts, whether it be movies, paintings, dance, poetry, or music. She seems to genuinely enjoy Senpai's art, frequently encouraging him to draw more and forcing him to use her as a model for his art. Although, whether or not it's to train him to draw the female body, get him to draw her specifically, or is just an excuse to spend time and tease him more, is unknown. Nagatoro herself also occasionally draws.

Despite very frequently making sexual jokes to Senpai, mocking him for being a virgin and calling him a pervert, she is very nervous and sensitive about sexuality. For example: when Senpai was giving her a piggy back ride and his hand slipped to her upper thigh, she proceeded to jump off and ran away with minimal explanation and a nervous and terrified expression on her face, when Senpai meant to push her in the elbow and instead hit her breasts, she was very outwardly shocked and embarrassed for a couple of seconds, she had no problem in riding senpai like a horse for "muscle training" until when two unnamed girls saw it, making her very self-aware and causing her to immediately jump off, when she accidentally facetimed Senpai in the bath, she screamed in terror, when she and Senpai were trapped under a gazebo during the rain and he saw her drenched clothes and bra, she instantly blushed in frustration, almost all those times, however, Nagatoro recovered after a couple of seconds and started again to accuse Senpai of grossness and sexual perversion, although he eventually realized that Nagatoro would be at a loss if he actually responded to her taunts romantically, and that Nagatoro is all bark and no bite, especially due to the fact that she can get as embarrassed as he does. The hypocritical humor of Nagatoro constantly teasing Senpai about being a virgin is that she's obviously as inexperienced with physical intimacy with the opposite sex as he is.

Nagatoro has a complex for her bust size and appears to be very self-conscious as well as jealous and possessive. In the beach chapters, when Gamo-chan and Yoshi were harassing Senpai with their large boobs, Nagatoro gets frustrated, took off her clothes as well, stood in a bikini in front of him, and demands Senpai to go buy drinks. She also was mortified when learning of Gamo-chan's prank to have Senpai "molest" her boobs - due to her jealousy since she is the least buxom among her friends - but nervously laughed it off as a hilarious prank upon learning that she had stuffed anpan in her breasts and Senpai never actually touched them. It also appears her teasing is somewhat just a front, a coping mechanism to mask her insecurities and inner nervousness.

She is also very athletic, loves the beach, is a fantastic swimmer and a superb skier as well as having a huge passion and proficiency in various styles of martial arts; she shows her willingness to train Senpai after his poor performance at a marathon and easily outpaces him during their training run.

Apparently, Nagatoro doesn't like shoes, as she rarely wears socks and is frequently barefoot when she can get away with it.

2.content:
"Yoshi" is a supporting character of the Don't Toy With Me, Miss Nagatoro manga series. She is a high school student and one of Nagatoro's friends. Yoshi is a simple-minded and somewhat childlike air-headed girl as well as a sort of sidekick within the 'cool kids' clique, which Gamo-chan, Sakura and Nagatoro herself are part of. She usually imitates or repeats her friends' gestures or last words and follows around Gamo-chan, helping whatever schemes she has in mind, especially teasing Senpai.

Yoshi is an attractive, average-statured high schooler with long, dirty-blonde hair pinned back in tight pigtails (occasionally low ones), with a distinctive curly cowlick right on the top of her head, that grew ever bigger during the course of the series and eventually split up into a second one. She has milky skin - only slightly darker than Senpai's - and large, somewhat absent-looking, hazel eyes. Both of her lobes are pierced, and she always wears stud pearl-like earrings. She was the second tallest out of Nagatoro's friends, until Sakura reached her height, albeit they are both several inches below Gamo-chan; however at the beginning of the story Yoshi was just a couple of inches taller than Nagatoro and had a very modest bust size, yet during the summer she underwent some puberty changes that at first made her taller and then turned her physique from skinny to curvy - with a slight hint of chubbiness - earning her the second-biggest bosom among her clique, though this has some consequences as she often appears slightly hunched over due to the weight, albeit she remained impressively athletic. Yoshi usually sports a vacant open-mouthed cat smile that signifies her lack of intelligence; also her pigtails fly up whenever she's surprised or excited.

She typically wears her school uniform consisting of a white button-up shirt (with loose sleeves and the collar never buttoned) and a navy blue skirt completed with a pair of sneakers and light soccer socks. However, in summer she wears a short-sleeved shirt in her uniform, while in winter she is shown to wear a light brown sweater and occasionally a blue blazer. She is also always seen wearing a spare hair tie as a bracelet on her right wrist.

When not at school her wardrobe consists of t-shirts, shorts, and sneakers/sandals, meaning, she's not one to groom herself. All her casual clothes have animal-related patterns.

Regardless of this, many of her quirks seem to come from a deep insecurity, as whenever asked what she wanted to do, Yoshi defers to Gamo-chan or Nagatoro for guidance, further proving her lack of confidence. She's also very fearful and easily impressionable, getting scared every time Nagatoro scolds her, when they are confronted by the President, and even admitting to being afraid of crossing the road when the traffic light is 'blinky'. As revealed in the Official Fanbook, she is a very pure and kind girl, so shy and meek to even having trouble saying "hi" to someone she knows if meeting said person casually.

In early chapters, she is shown to be very socially driven and popular among boys, even more than Gamo-chan and Nagatoro, and is often seen flirting with them or being approached by guys with flirting intentions. Due to this, Yoshi often tries to act as the matchmaker for her friends, planning various double dates. However, this flirtatious aspect is downplayed in later chapters and mostly overtaken by Sakura, leading the latter to be depicted as the matchmaker in the anime adaptation while Yoshi, as demonstrated later on in the story, when the girls talk about romance is the only one who is not questioned since - as shown in a bonus strip of Volume 14 - her friends deemed it "too soon" for her.

Her hidden depths are her love for animals, dogs in particular, and being extremely physically affectionate, tending to externalize her affections to others with frequent hugs and caresses which, combined with a very low sense of personal space, prompt her to have an obsession to touch Senpai's hair due to how fluffy it is. She is also implied to be a closet geek, being a fan of "One Piece" and "YuYu Hakusho",[46] enjoying Junji Ito's work, managing to identify the Fusion Dance from "Dragon Ball Z", knowing specific sh≈çgi moves like "murisuji", and often mentioning genre movie actors such as Ichikawa Ebiz≈ç XI, besides actually really appreciating Senpai's manga. Furthermore, she's an amazingly skilled mascot designer and is regarded as a "cuteness aficionado" by her friends. Yoshi also enjoys singing very much, though she is extremely tone-deaf.

She is also extremely athletic, loves the beach, is capable of effortlessly skiing down a pro course with the snowboard and is likely the most physically performing out of all her friends, has proven to be capable of almost inhuman feats such as possessing enough strength to constrict someone with one hand, or running at such an amazing speed to act as a windbreak. Also, she has impressive eyesight, remarkable observation skills and a surprisingly good knowledge of Frenchnand especially English, as well as classic Chinese poetry and philosophy.

Yoshi is the most gluttonous of the girls' group, eating everything regardless of how unhealthy it may be. Most background scenes that show her will depict her eating something.

Yoshi usually refers to Senpai as "Sense", as short for "Manga no Sensei".

3.content:
Maki Gamou better known as "Gamo-chan", is a supporting character of the Don't Toy With Me, Miss Nagatoro manga series. She is a high school student and Nagatoro's best friend. Gamo-chan is a confident, popular, driven, and quite aggressive girl as well as the nominal ringleader of the 'cool kids' clique, which Yoshi, Sakura and Nagatoro herself are part of. She and Nagatoro share a sort of friendly rivalry and, being the first one who get aware of her friend's feelings for Senpai, she enjoy teasing him and pulling unique pranks as her own way to help their relationship.

Gamo-chan is an attractive, tall, and statuary high schooler with long, fiery orange hair - which she likely bleaches since they turn lighter in a gradient towards the tips - usually scruffy and a little unkempt. She has porcelain skin, although not delicate, and large, expressive orange eyes that perfectly match her hair color. She has removable[10] double piercings on her upper left ear, but those are usually covered by her hairs. She is the tallest out of Nagatoro's friends - almost as tall as Senpai - and is also the bustiest, albeit Yoshi reached her cup size after her summer puberty changes. An amazonian beauty, she has a toned, muscular, flexible, and extremely athletic physique with well-defined abs, a shapely musculature[ and generous breasts, a feature which is often Nagatoro's envy. Gamo-chan sports almost always a smug sneer and a fascinating eyelid which is higher than the other, also she tends to thin her pupils whenever she grins.

She typically wears her school uniform consisting of a white button-up shirt (with sleeves always rolled up and collar never buttoned) and a navy blue skirt completed with a pair of sneakers and dark soccer socks. However, in summer she wears a short-sleeved shirt in her uniform, while in winter she is shown to wear a light brown sweater and occasionally a blue blazer. She is also often seen wearing a circular bracelet on her left wrist and have prominently been shown with her judogi.

When not at school she always sports a very stylish, glamorous, elaborate, rock-fashion, and yet feminine choice of clothing.

Gamo-chan appears as an aggressive, harsh, sarcastic, cunning, and bossy girl with a sadistic streak just as evident as Nagatoro's. She's the strongest bully out of the girls' clique and in a profile it's stated that she likes to mock people. An utterly outspoken individual, she's not shy in overstepping the boundaries or being rude to Senpai in both manner and words. However, this is insinuated to be an act, as doing so she causes Nagatoro to go the extra mile in proving he's a worthy guy and ultimately bringing the pair closer together. Proving this, despite being Senpai's most vicious critic, she only insults Senpai when Nagatoro can hear it, while when they're alone and she can't defend him, she acted almost friendly. As time passes, regardless of her constant jokes questioning his sexual drive and manliness on several occasions, Gamo-chan got significantly kinder toward Senpai, treating him like one of her friends and acting very at ease with him, even to the point of easily admitting she finds him someone who's "pretty funny" to be with and eventually calling him "a friend of hers".

Despite her general attitude, Gamo-chan is also very calm and level-headed as she never loses her composure and has proven to be quite patient and thoughtful. A "jerk with a heart of gold", though she always keeps a tough facade, Gamo-chan is actually sweeter and more caring toward her friends than she lets on: when she noticed Nagatoro was feeling bad for Senpai not swimming with them while they were at the beach she tried to cheer her up telling her that if he didn't want to they couldn't force him, when Nagatoro sulks at her due to a comment she made on her bust size Gamo-chan felt genuinely bad, explained what she meant by saying that big-breasts were better and pointing out that regardless of that Nagatoro was "cute", also she gets concerned about how Nagatoro was feeling when almost all the cheers were for Orihara during the judo tournament, worried deeply for her when she got injured and confronted the boy after he made her cry when they had their first fight as a couple. She got really upset when Sakura got stalked, acted almost motherly to Yoshi over her fear of crossing the road, is very patient toward her when she tries to accompany her in singing albeit tone-deaf, took care of her when she gets lost in the crowd - as shown in an extra sketch of Volume 4 - and can't be described as anything less but proud the very first time the girl stood up to her.

While progressively taking a liking for Senpai, she also started to show the same level of kindness and caring to him, making a plan to help him defeat the President and keep the art club active, supporting him during the school marathon, preparing him a special dish of her invention at the sushi, reassuring him about Nagatoro's condition after she got the flu, inviting him to hang out with her clique for Christmas Eve, offering him to train with Nagatoro at her family's gym to get ready for the judo tournament, joining his group for the field trip and smiling happily in approval whenever Senpai shows a little backbone or Nagatoro does something that brings them a little closer together. As revealed in the Official Fanbook, she is considered a sort of "big-sister figure" among her friends. Gamo-chan can also be quite chatty when she feels at ease with someone.

She is very good friends with Sakura and Yoshi, who loved to follow her around and repeat what she says and does, while Nagatoro could be considered her best friend, despite their similar and often competitive personalities sometimes putting them at odds in a sort of friendly Also, Gamo-chan's love for teasing Nagatoro to fuel her feelings for Senpai sometimes pushes her to cause pranks that led the two to resort to near-physical violence despite they seemingly always making peace rather quickly every time they fight. Being quite relaxed, Gamo-chan generally backs down in most situations, but it should be noted that she's the only character who's not afraid to fight Nagatoro when they disagree. Also, judging by their friends' reactions whenever Gamo-chan and Nagatoro butt heads, it's not wise to make them mad, implying that they both have a temper warranting fear. Nevertheless, the two girls genuinely loves one another and, under their harsh personalities, are very supportive and caring to each other.

Despite her beauty and apparent sexual confidence - never getting embarrassed from showing off her body - it's implied that Gamo-chan is the less experienced with the other sex out of the girls. Likely due to her blunt and scary attitude, she's not as popular among boys as Sakura, Yoshi, and Nagatoro; while the others have been all seen interacting with guys, Gamo-chan has rarely spoken to a boy in the whole series (the only exceptions being Senpai and when asking the games club members to be quieter), in one occasion two boys approached her clique to flirt, yet all of their attentions were for the other three girls, almost completely ignoring her if not to greet. Also, she went to the summer festival with Yoshi,[84] while in Japan is usually attended by couples and, albeit not so uncommon going with a friend, it's mostly done by those who haven't a date. When at the beach, after noticing Senpai's stunned reaction while looking at her body, she seems almost flattered.

On Christmas Eve, she got quite upset when her friends dumped her invitation to the karaoke because they had plans with boys, proving to be both saddened and - deep down - a little envious. Despite this, she reacted wholeheartedly at how obvious Nagatoro and Senpai were on wanting to spend time together and felt genuinely bad after trying to interfere with the couple's first date out of misplaced concern. Gamo-chan's claim that her lack of sentimental life is due to having "pretty high standards" and not being interested in "weaklings", thus wanting a man that is at least stronger than her, however this is mostly an excuse she told to herself as it was revealed that she actually has a huge crush on her best friend's brother, Taiga Nagatoro; she acts very bashfully and awkwardly both when interacting with him and when speaking about him, although when asked about it, she promptly denied it saying she simply "respects" him as a great sparring partner.

She is also very athletic, loves the beach, and is a fantastic swimmer, managing to race against Nagatoro in a swimming contest, on the school cross country, while skiing down a pro course, and even sharing her same proficiency in the same amount of martial arts styles, despite having a special liking for boxing. Nagatoro herself claims that it's hard to get a clear winner when she's against her in a match and has great respect for her strength.

Gamo-chan usually refers to Senpai calling him "Paisen" , a play on the term "senpai" usually used in a cutesy, playful, or casual way.

4.content:
Sakura is a supporting character of the Don't Toy With Me, Miss Nagatoro manga series. She is a high school student and one of Nagatoro's friends. Sakura is a sweet and kind, albeit quite flirtatious girl, who dresses in a gyaru style of fashion and is part of a 'cool kids' clique, together with Gamo-chan, Yoshi and Nagatoro herself. She often takes part in her friends' mayhem but, regardless of this, is always extremely friendly towards Senpai.

Sakura is a cute, average-statured high schooler with medium-length (chest-length at the beginning and later shoulder-length), wavy platinum blonde hair - although it's implied that she dyes them since sometimes a slightly darker regrowth is visible. Her bangs are pinned to both sides of her face with a pair of white hair clips (whom she later stop wear). She has fully tanned skin and large, inquisitive brown eyes, which were at first depicted as droopy and with noticeable eye bags, hinting some kind of sleep disorder that she later overcame, as her eyes were since shown round, bright and without eye bags. Her eyebrows are thicker than many other characters and dyed blonde as well. At first, she was not too much taller than Nagatoro, but later grew as tall as Yoshi; Sakura has a lean, well-proportioned and slender physique with large bust size, considering her size and build. She seems to be quite fit but not as athletic as her friends even due to her laziness. Sakura often wears a tired or delicate smile which signifies her laid-back personality.

A gyaru (or gal), specifically a kogal, she typically wears her school uniform consisting of a white button-up shirt (with one flap always out of her skirt and collar never buttoned) and a shortened navy blue skirt completed with a pair of sneakers and loose socks. However, in summer she wears a short-sleeved shirt in her uniform, while in winter she is shown to wear a light brown sweater, loafers and occasionally a well-buttoned blue blazer.

When not at school she usually sports an extremely stylish and elaborate choice of clothing.

Sakura appears as an easy-going, calm, level-headed, laid-back, sweet, and lovely individual with an innate predisposition to be flirty, to the point of having a reputation of being an accomplished seductress among her clique of friends, and jokingly saying her guardian spirit is an oiran. Compared to the other girls, Sakura is the kindest of them all - even appearing somewhat coy at times - and the only one who can't be described as an outright bully but rather a teaser, whose innuendo toward Senpai appear to be for the most accidental, since she openly sees him as a friend and even goes to him to be comforted when she feels scared or sad. Also, after realizing that Nagatoro has feelings for him and vice versa, Sakura stopped assertively teasing him and started to support their growing relationship much like her friends. However, being a master in girlish flirt poses, she retains her habit of using them on every boy she talks to, Senpai included.

Despite having been described by her character profile as having an "haraguro" personality, meaning a two-faced attitude, usually cute on the outside but cruel on the inside, in the Official Fanbook, it was stated that she simply really loves to "be pampered" and "play around". Sakura has always been shown as nothing else but nice and, even if she does indeed possess a manipulative side and has demonstrated to be perfectly capable of sowing seeds of jealousy among a group of boys or using them for her profit, she doesn't appear to do it with a malevolent intention or to cause anyone harm. Proving this, she gets distressed and breaks into tears whenever serious consequences ensue from her action, being quick to recognize her errors and make amends with the ones she hurt, as she demonstrated by befriending one of the group of boys she tried to break up. Also, she is very forgiving, having ultimately forgiven her stalker and acted as the peacemaker between her friends when Nagatoro sulked at Gamo-chan and Yoshi for having gotten in the way of her date with Senpai.

Being very curious and inquisitive, Sakura has an innate ability to "read people" and understand what they think, thus knowing what to appeal to is the main reason she can manipulate others so easily. Due to this trait of her personality however, she's also quite emphatic and capable to easily understand the feelings behind other people's actions.

She is the most popular among boys out of all of her friends and the only one who has had previous relationships or some kind of experience, albeit it's unclear to what extent; she once stated to be single in a way that implied she had more than one ex but, according to Nagatoro, she "let them pitch but never let them score" implying she's actually quite chaste. Nevertheless, on Christmas Eve, she was seen making out with a boy who nervously describes her as "pretty aggressive" and she later claim to have had a fling with two boys at the same time, albeit describe it as if not significant at all.

Despite all this, it is also often suggested Sakura may have sapphic tendencies, thus either being an in-the-closet lesbian, bisexual or pansexual, since she blushed and had excited reactions while looking at the President's body or Shikki's nakedness and was quite eager to fondle Gamo-chan and Fujimin in order to be the judge of their "breasts size battle" (whom she herself suggested).

Despite being that outgoing regarding sexuality and romance however, she had also stated that she mostly didn't kiss, especially in public, implying she regard it as something needing more intimacy and affection.

Sakura is very kind and helpful to the people she likes and has demonstrated to be the most emotionally collected girl in her group of friends, having a hippie-like and pacifist life philosophy according to which "mankind are all brothers and sisters" and "should all make up and have fun". She is also strictly against following the "an eye for an eye" belief, as when Gamo-chan suggested Nagatoro to pose in the nude to beat the President, she quoted said principle, stating that "lewdness for lewdness will only bring sadness"; despite her friends look at her as a "weirdo" for said convictions. Sakura is also a gamer girl and a VR enthusiast, as well as a huge yaoi enjoyer. She is widely knowledgeable in myths, rumors, and romance stories, though whether she believes in them is debatable. Sakura is also implied to be quite the daddy's girl and was shown to dress quite conservatively while with her father compared to the attire she sports at school or when hanging out with her friends.

She is very athletic, though not as much as her friends, and seems to be a fan of wrestling, as well as far stronger than she appears. She is quite good at running and capable of effortlessly skiing down a pro course with a snowboard. Despite always looking tired, lazy, and procrastinating - even having a bad academic performance -, Sakura is implied to be a very hard-working young woman since those are likely consequences of exhaustion due to her part-time job.

Sakura is very polite, she always refers to everyone using appropriate suffixes - including her closest friends - so she addresses Senpai by adding to his nickname the suffix "-kun", which in Japan is generally used when referring to men in general, male children/teenagers, or male friends.

5.content:
Naoto Hachiouji is one of the two main characters of the Don't Toy With Me, Miss Nagatoro manga series. He is a high school student who constantly gets teased by Nagatoro, the other main character, who always refers to him as "Senpai". He is an introvert, twitchy, loner, nerdy and shy aspiring artist, who tries to avoid social interaction with other people and doesn't seem to have any friends although, as the story progresses, he bonds with Gamo-chan, Yoshi, Sakura and Nagatoro herself, for whom he also harbors strong feelings and who eventually became his girlfriend. Senpai is the only remaining member of the art club beside the former President and later Sunomiya. During the final chapters he managed to enter Tokyo University of the Arts.

In the manga, Senpai is mostly unnamed, however, in addition to the pet name used by Nagatoro, all the other characters call him by a different nickname: to Gamo-chan he is "Paisen", to Yoshi he's "Sense", and Sakura adds the suffix "-kun" also, his friends and family calls him "Nao-kun"  while at Kainan he was nicknamed "Hatchi".

Senpai is a very tall, gangling, and angular build high schooler with a well-defined chin and curly, "fluff-like" brown hair, often compared to a sheep's fleece. He has an extremely pale and delicate complexion - so much that he gets sunburnt easily - and sharp, twitching-prone brown eyes. He is short-sighted and always wears a pair of horn-rimmed glasses, although he can see somewhat decently even without them and later starts to wear lenses. Often described as a "bean sprout", Senpai is slender, incredibly weak and has a bony, dry, skinny, and very inflexible[physique with his arms being so thin that they could be contained in a girl's grip, but relatively defined pecs. Nagatoro frequently calls him "gross", yet he is actually decently handsome and both the girl and her friends have shown to find him quite attractive.

He typically wears his school uniform consisting of a white button-up shirt (whose sleeves and collar he always keeps tightly buttoned) and black trousers completed with a pair of sneakers. However, in summer he wears a short-sleeved shirt in his uniform, while in winter he is shown to wear a cardigan and occasionally a blue blazer.

When not at school he usually sports a plain, practical, or classic-styled choice of clothing.

Senpai started off as an extremely frail, weak, introverted, shy, and somewhat doormat individual with a few masochistic tendencies. Despite being pestered and bullied on a daily basis by Nagatoro, he never fought off any of her antics and put up with it, even after being put through a wide range of embarrassing situations. Having been bullied most of his life by lots of people, he adopted the philosophy that indifference is safety, thus he usually responds to bullying by trying to stay calm, avoiding his tormentors' gaze, closing his heart, and letting it pass; doing so, he developed a defense mechanism that made him unable to even remember the faces of the people who bullied him.

Despite his emotional frailty, he apparently never cried before meeting Nagatoro, who succeeded in making him cry twice. At first, he took Nagatoro's bullying at face value, usually remaining deeply affected by her words and attempting to look away but, as the story progressed, her teasing mellowed out, and their relationship became outwardly friendly, despite the fact that she keeps calling him "gross". As time passes, he has become able to talk more naturally to her and on some occasions, he has rebuked her and even teased her back.

Senpai tends to blush quite easily, and usually gets as red as a cherry in a significant part of his interactions with Nagatoro, as he is somewhat shy when it comes to girls. Fundamentally, he is a sweet and kind young man, in spite of his antisociality, and, deep inside, he is more than aware of the fact that Nagatoro is so insistent in keeping him company, proving to be more than willing to dispense kindness towards Nagatoro regardless of how she treats him, as well as becoming very determined and assertive when protecting her; an example of this is when he gets behind her in order to cover her back, as some guys were trying to ogle at her while in line due to her sweat having made her shirt transparent. Some other examples of this would be when he intentionally grabbed her wrist, dragging her out of the line to a vending machine to save her from a heatstroke, or when dragging her out of a moving crowd when she risked being overwhelmed due to her short stature, and standing up for her when a couple of classmates criticized her drawings. Moreover, he is a real gentleman and, despite his not-so-well-hidden love for fanservice-heavy media, Senpai never attempts to do anything remotely lewd or rude towards either Nagatoro or her friends, not even once. This happens to be one of the reasons they enjoy his presence and feel comfortable around him, along with the perception that, unlike most of the other male students that approach them, he is nowhere as expendable as them, coming across as a unique individual. They take a liking to him because, among other things, he's not a superfluous person and doesn't have the heart to be duplicitous.

As the manga goes on, Senpai gradually establishes a good relationship with Nagatoro's clique of friends: Sakura is always very kind and respectful toward him, Yoshi found him quite amusing and has a fondness for the fluffiness of his hair, while Gamo-chan, despite often being rude to him, has actually shown to consider him a friend and that her taunts directed at him are meant to rouse Nagatoro as she's the couple's first supporter.

He is, overall, a very skilled artist, especially at drawing manga, and runs his own fantasy manga series, where the main character is Siegfried, a skilled swordsman who's bad at getting on in the world. The character is actually a handsome-er and more manly self-insert of him, while the female lead is a beautiful knight named Elizabeth who bears a striking resemblance to the President, even the events depicted in the story are mirroring his life as evidenced by the fact that at some point the two main characters have to part ways, as happened when she was forced to leave the club activities to go to cram school. Later, Senpai began to insert new characters like Nekotoro, a cat version of Nagatoro, a whip-holding bandit with the likeness of Gamo-chan and a furry-like bunny girl inspired to Yoshi.

Despite this, his self-esteem seems to be low as a consequence of suffering constant bullying throughout his whole life. He frequently said that "all he can do is draw", and even then he frequently stated he had trouble getting inspiration to draw, and thus ended up beating himself up inside about it, although he admits that he would like to be praised, but at the same time says that he could never get complimented by anyone because he has no talents. He began in the series unable to draw any female form at all due to nervousness, however, he eventually overcame the problem. One of the things Nagatoro prods him about the most is the fact that he tends to give up on things before even trying, despite the fact that the girl has displayed actual faith in him.

seems to enjoy shonen manga, typically those with large amounts of fan service, though he is very defensive about it when called out by Nagatoro, saying he only likes it for either the comedy, the action, or the art. Nagatoro describes him as a "quiet pervert", and despite often denying it, he has often shown to have frequent "lewd" thoughts, even to the point of imagining the President stark naked while she was talking to him about the nature, and he can't help admiring Nagatoro's occasional fanservice or that of her equally attractive friends.

Apparently, Senpai has some sort of social anxiety disorder, stating to not like crowded places due to the "normie aura" they had. In the beginning, he seemingly had no friends other than Nagatoro's clique, as shown by the fact that he never interacted with anyone else and has been shown to not have any other numbers in his phone other than Nagatoro's, but later on he's shown to be quite close to a few classmates, and his kouhai-senpai relationship with the President is revealed.

He doesn't enjoy many things in his life besides playing video games, drawing, and spending time with Nagatoro and her friends. He doesn't like to go outside, or athletics or engaging in any form of physical activities, although he later starts to feel some joy in these activities due to his interactions with his kouhai, even admitting that "it's okay every once in a while".

He has the habit of adjusting his glasses by the bridge when embarrassed and humorously retains this even after switching to lenses.

6.content:
Misaki Nagatoro is a minor character of the Don't Toy With Me, Miss Nagatoro manga series. She is a university student, Hayase and Taiga Nagatoro's older sister as well as her family's oldest child. She is a mature, playful and friendly young woman who likes to tease her little sister despite caring and loving her deeply as well as being a confidant and sort of role model for the protagonist. After realizing the true feelings between her younger sister and Senpai, she decided to help and fuel their budding relationship.

Senpai and Gamo-chan only call her "Big Sis-Toro"

Misaki is a beautiful, shapely, and average-statured young woman with medium-length, straight black hair that falls on her forehead in a thick fringe (later briefly decolorized and shortened at the tips[9]). She has relatively light skin, and large, expressive, yet somewhat tired-looking dark amber-maroon eyes, with an attractive mole under the left one, that act as a beauty mark as well as her signature feature. Her ears are not pierced and she does not seem to wear earrings or any kind of jewelry. Misaki is very similar to her younger sister in terms of physical shape, sharing her lean, athletic, slender, and flexible physique,[ albeit with a noticeably larger bust size and wider hips due to being a young adult rather than a teen. Misaki sports almost always a wide, kind, and sweet smile displaying incisors slightly more pronounced than average, as well as her family's signature prominent canines. She shares many facial expression with her little sister and, exactly like her, tends to widen the pupil of just an eye whenever she grins.

Albeit not as tomboyish as her little sister, Misaki is nor even a stylish woman, as she typically wears practical, sporty or simple-style clothes; loose-fitting t-shirts and sweatshirts, tights, jeans or short[ pants and sneakers; however she's perfectly capable to dressing-up if required for special occasions, sporting elegant dark suits. She is also often seen wearing a judogi.

Misaki is a calm, cheerful, easy-going, and level-headed young woman with a bit of a liking for teasing, just like her little sister Hayase, although at a much lower level. She loves to joke and is very friendly. When first introducing herself to Senpai she makes him believe she would have called the police and have him arrested for trespassing into her home, only to reveal she was merely kidding and then inviting him inside. A very mature and responsible person, Misaki behaves like an excellent hostess to Senpai and takes good care of her sister, to whom she's very protective and caring.

She's described as the type who enjoys spoiling her little sister. Yet she has also proved to know Hayase so well that she managed to easily "manipulate" her, making her "dance in the palm of her hands" - much to Senpai's astonishment - even to the point of talking her around when she acted stubbornly or scolding her about her manners when she didn't behave, showing to be very polite and well-mannered. Misaki is very excitable, inquisitive, and honest, despite this blunt attitude of hers sometimes creating awkward situations and being a source of embarrassment for Hayase, albeit mostly unintentional. According to her little sister, she tends to "run her mouth off". Also, it's insinuated that she may be quite vain and even a little bit megalomaniacal, despite all this, she's also quite sensitive, as proven when she's shown to be moved to the point of tears after her little sister's speech for the third years' graduation.

It's also shown that Misaki could emanate the same intimidating aura as her younger sister, and, whenever this happens, she is depicted with hellish shadows all over her face and disturbingly huge eyes pupils, making her look like a ghostly entity. As the "cool big sis" and model figure to Nagatoro, she's a sort of confidant to her; Nagatoro told her about Senpai more than once, indirectly making her aware of how she felt about him as well as their "erotic" interaction. Although she somewhat likes to tease her little sister and sometimes embarrass her, treating her as if she was still a little kid, or teasing her about romance, Misaki does love her deeply, is rather protective of her, and willing to help the relationship between her and Senpai, often offering to tell the latter more about Nagatoro if he wanted. It is also strongly implied that Hayase looks up to her greatly, trying to emulate her attitude and having learned how to "tease" boys from her, as well as often going to her for advice,[38] looking at her skills in awe, listening to her lessons, and eventually doing what she suggested despite her stubbornness.

In stark contrast with the maturity she usually displays, Misaki seems to have a habit of eavesdropping and very little sense of personal space. She can also be quite careless since she forgot to close the house's front gate before going shopping.

She's extremely athletic and has an amazing combat prowess and Orihara herself described her as way stronger than her. She seemingly shares her sister's dislike for wearing shoes, but not socks, as she has always been seen wearing "invisible socks" rather than going barefoot.

7.content:
Sana Sunomiya is a supporting character of the Don't Toy With Me, Miss Nagatoro manga series. She is a high school - later university - student who served as the "President" of the art club whom Senpai is a member of. The President is a serious, stern, and responsible girl, albeit with a habit of public nudity. Despite being semi-retired due to attending a cram school for art university entrance, she still manages the club's bureaucracy and logistics, eventually becoming enraged and starting a sort of feud with Gamo-chan, Yoshi, Sakura, and especially Nagatoro after they turned the club room into their hangout, although she recognizes the younger girl's role as Senpai's muse, thus becoming a supporter of their relationship. Later in the story, she graduates and starts attending Tokyo University of the Arts.

The President is a beautiful, shapely, and very tall young woman with long, straight, dark purplish-black hair that reaches the end of her back (and that she occasionally keeps tied up in a ponytail or a chignon) and a jagged fringe. She has a royal pallor alike, delicate-looking, fair skin - depicted as so clear that seems to glow in the dark - and sharp, cold-looking crimson eyes. In terms of height she towers over every other female character of the series, as well as most males, and has a Junoesque, imposing, and athletic physique which has been described as "unreal", with a firm butt, massive boobs, a thin waist, long legs, and slender arms. Having practiced kendo since early childhood, she's also very muscular and toned. Her breasts are her most distinctive feature, and they are often exaggerated for comedic effect. The President is rarely seen smiling or smirking and sports an intimidating frown or scowl most of the time.

When she was a high schooler, she typically wore her school uniform consisting of a white button-up shirt (whose sleeves and collar she always kept fully buttoned), a red knot tie, and a long navy blue skirt completed with tights and a pair of sneakers. However, in winter she was shown to wear a light brown sweater and occasionally a blue blazer.

When not at school, and after starting to attend university, she was primarily shown wearing traditional Japanese clothing or extremely skimpy Chinese-style ones as well as a leather catsuit; however she always prefers being completely naked and seemingly doesn't wear any underwear

The President is a stoic, stern, no-nonsense, dutiful, and brooding individual. She treats everything seriously while everyone else is flustered, intimidated, or else taking it more lightly, which makes it extremely difficult to realize whether or not she was joking, if ever. Also, she's usually very dramatic, especially when she's fired up about art, over which she's quite passionate, proving to have a true artist's soul and following a life philosophy according to which the secret to creating an authentic piece of art is love. She comes off as a mentor figure and a source of inspiration and encouragement for Senpai, albeit intimidating, authoritarian, and disciplinarian to the point he describes her as "a bit scary". The President also tends to be judgmental, describing Nagatoro and her clique as "a bunch of good-for-nothings" without really knowing them and assuming their presence made Senpai unproductive (which is a rough and false assumption); this is the main reason for the animosity between her and the girls who, despite what she wrongly assumed about them, always manage to defeat her.

The President is also absolutely shameless or at least extremely nonchalant about the nude human form, particularly her own. This is expressed through her art and through exhibiting noticeable nudist tendencies often throughout the series, showing no embarrassment at anyone seeing her nude, regardless of who they are. As revealed in the Official Fanbook, she does really like to be naked whenever she can get away with it and is later confirmed to also be a streaker, with a habit of running around school naked late at night, eventually creating the legend of Kazehaya High School's "Ghost of the Pale Woman"

Although she dresses conservatively in a school uniform with a much longer skirt than Nagatoro, Gamo-chan, Yoshi or Sakura, she never wears any underwear, has no qualms about talking to Senpai while wearing just a towel, taking off everything in front of him while being indifferent to his unease, doing fully nude self-portrait from the back and from the front on each Culture Festival, modeling for Senpai in just a swimsuit (implying she wore less in the past for her club members), running a school marathon in a skimpy playboy bunny suit, making no attempt to cover herself after being caught naked by Nagatoro and Senpai in the woods - declaring the wind blew away her robe while she was taking reference photos - and treating the situation very matter-of-factly as she was on her way to just hike down in the buff. She also once advised Senpai to "free himself" and seek inspiration in the outdoors, as she always did, prompting him to imagine her dancing naked into the woods. The President considers her body a powerful tool to convey the sense of artistic pursuit in a holistic manner, but seems largely unaware of how truly stunning she is or the effect she has on people as she behaves in a largely asexual manner despite exuding sexiness in every inch of her artwork. Regardless of this, she once used her charm and intimidating aura to fake a lesbian interest for Nagatoro in order to make her uncomfortable.

It was also slightly hinted that she finds pleasure in humiliation, since after Nagatoro's clique forced her to wear a playboy bunny suit after she lost against them at the Culture Festival and paraded her through the school, she stated to have found it embarrassing but that the oppressive feeling was an experience that made her creativity burst forth as if she was about to "unleash something yet unseen before", prompting her to start to wear said costume willingly.

In spite of her intimidating aura, she and Nagatoro can inadvertently get into the same goofy situations much to Senpai's discomfort,[also she might have a certain level of hidden feelings for the boy, greatly respecting him as a fellow artist and, recognizing Nagatoro as his muse, being more than willing to support the relationship between them as she preferred his happiness over her own interests. She's seemingly seeking to make him a better person and bring him out of his shell, particularly focusing on his art skills in a "stern teacher" kind of way.

She has a habit to pose quite often with her arms crossed to convey her authority and demeanor, and also to support her large chest..

8.content:
Aihara is a background character of the Don't Toy With Me, Miss Nagatoro manga series. He is a high school student and schoolmate of Senpai at Kainan Art Preparation School as well as a member of its "Triumvirate" alongside Hashimoto and Machida, whom later become known as the "Big Four" after Senpai join them.

Aihara is an average-stature high schooler with a well proportioned physique, a boyish chin, delicate features and short, straight, brown hair falling on his forhead in a fringe. Aihara has light complexion, thin eyebrows, large expressive brown eyes and a prominent canine on the left side of his mouth. He's almos always seen sporting a relaxed and laid down look on his face. Just like Hashimoto, he is quite a flirty boy and has an eye for the ladies.

He has a liking for simple-style clothing, colored shirts or t-shirts, long bermuda pants and sneakers.

Aihara is a calm and friendly individual, albeit very curious and prone to talk about other people and arguments that catch his attention, as he's the one who inquires his friends about what they think of Senpai. He doesn't seem to be a competitive guy, due to be perfectly happy about getting third place in his cram school's evaluation; also, he is very open to change his mind about other people if needed, being quite pleased to find out Senpai was a more passionate person than he first thought, and often acting as peacemaker when Machida lose her temper, even to the point to sometimes physically hold her. Just like Hashimoto, he is quite a flirty boy and has an eye for the ladies.

Despite seeming a ittle more patient about the nickname given to them by the school than his friends, Aihara still doesn't like being referred to as "Triumvirate", but apparently enjoy "Big Four" a bit more. A popular and well-liked individual, he has lot of friends who eagerly would model for him even with little-to-no forewarning; also he has great perception skills.

9.content:
Asaka is a background character of the Don't Toy With Me, Miss Nagatoro manga series. She is a high school student and a member of the judo club as well as a schoolmate and friend of Shikki; however, while the latter has a progressively better relationship with Nagatoro, she and Fujimin mostly kept a sort of animosity toward the latter and her clique, albeit ultimately getting somewhat friendlier.

 Asaka is an attractive and very tall, high schooler with long, straight brown hair - whom she usually keeps in a low ponytail, especially when at judo club, but occasionally combed to the side - and a jagged fringe falling on her face. She has a fair complexion, thin eyebrows and large, unsympathetic and apathy-looking droopy blue eyes. She has an athletic and lean physique with medium-sized yet well-proportioned breasts, despite seeming somewhat smaller in term of bra size, if compared to the other female characters. Apparently Asaka has a tendency to zip her lips to the side as well as grinning or smirking very often.

She typically wears her school uniform consisting of a white button up shirt (with the collar never buttoned) and a navy blue skirt completed with a pair of sneakers and white soccer socks. However, in summer she wears a short-sleeved shirt in her uniform, while in winter she is shown to occasionally wear a well-buttoned blue blazer. She has also prominently been shown wearing her judogi.

Asaka is very concerned about the judo club's reputation and feels offended that Nagatoro, whom she deems "the one who ran away from Orihara with her tail between her legs" was welcomed back into the club. Because of this, she acts mean and spiteful towards her, often criticizing and mocking her. She seemingly has a tag-along personality and tends to follow Shikki in whatever she does but, in stark contrast with the latter, is not as easily intimidated, albeit seemingly beeing quite a coward if on her own, and sweating heavily in tense situations. Also, when Shikki apologized to Nagatoro, although doing the same, she's the only girl in the group who keep frowning, implying she didn't feel any regret and is only doing it because of the others.

Asaka could be considered the meanest out of her trio - always very eager to disrespecting or bodyshaming pretty much everyone - is very provocative and also a bit of a meddler with no qualms about stalking others for the sole purpose of mocking or hurting them for fun. However she's also the weaker - or at least the less athletic - among her clique as she's the only one who wasn't selected for the judo tournament and has never actually show a passion nor any real interest for judo, despite being unanimously considered very knowledgeable about it.

The nature of her relationship with Fujimin is quite uncertain as they have great chemistry, seem very affectionate to one another and she has no qualms in publicly say to having touched the latter's breasts and knowing how soft they are. Futhermore, during their free day in Kyoto the two have been seen hanging out together (without Shikki) close to a the city's top matchmaking spot, Jishu Shrine, wearing matching rented kimonos. Asaka has shown to be very proud of Fujimin's achievements, often bragging about them as if she was actually bragging about the girl herself.

Usually very sarcastic and malicious, she's prone to bad-mouthing and insulting others, regardless of them being fellow students or professor but is also very realistic, thoughtful and skeptical, often preventing Fujimin to jump at conclusion without looking at the facts, also she's seemingly looser and way much forgiving about transgressing at rules or protocols. Despite her usual rudeness, after realizing about Shikki's budding exhibitionist streak, she began to tease her in a quite friendly manner and firmly stand up for the "Naked Kamen" when others mock her, proving she can be very supportive toward her friends. Also, as the story progress, she mellowed down her hostility towards Nagatoro's clique.

10.content:
Fujimiya (Ëó§ÂÆÆ, Fujimiya), better known as "Fujimin", is a background character of the Don't Toy With Me, Miss Nagatoro manga series. She is a high school student and a member of the judo club as well as a schoolmate and friend of Shikki; however, while the latter has a progressively better relationship with Nagatoro, she and Asaka mostly kept a sort of animosity toward the latter and her clique, albeit ultimately getting somewhat friendlier.

Fujimin is an attractive and tall, high schooler with medium-long, straight, brown bobbed hair whose bangs are pinned to both sides of her face, albeit some tufts tend to escape and occasionally cover one of her eyes. She has a fair complexion, thick eyebrows and large, brown eyes characterized by very thin pupils, hypnotic-like double concentric iris and strong eyelash. She has an athletic and lean yet somewhat skinny physique with a modest bust size - seeming a little undeveloped if compared with her peers, albeit she later gained a cup getting quite well endowed. Apparently Fujimin has a tendency to zip her lips to the side as well as smiling devilishly when excited, displaying a set of extremely prominent canines.

She typically wears her school uniform consisting of a white button up shirt (with slightly unbuttoned collar) and a navy blue skirt completed with a pair of sneakers and white soccer socks. However, in summer she wears a short-sleeved shirt in her uniform, while in winter she is shown to occasionally wear a well-buttoned blue blazer. She has also prominently been shown wearing her judogi.

When not at school she usually wears sporty clothes.

Fujimin is very passionate over judo and thus felt offended that Nagatoro, who previously left the sport due to losing one match, was welcomed back into the club, prompting her to act quite mean and spiteful toward the girl; often criticizing and mocking her. She seemingly has a tag-along personality and follow around Shikki in whatever she did but, in stark contrast with the latter, she's not as easily intimidated, especially by boys. Albeit prone to jump to conclusion and judge people by the first impression, Fujimin easily back down when really angering someone and, when Shikki apologized to Nagatoro she seemed to be sorry as well, implying she's capable of understand and feel regret when she's wrong.

Moreover, she seemingly value team work deeply, having been shown smiling in approval when Nagatoro and Orihara made peace at the judo tournament as well as acting sportingly after being defeated by Gamo-chan despite her animosity towards her and even acting a little friendlier to her after she had shown her value in their match. Also, as the story progress, she mellowed down her hostility towards Nagatoro's clique.

Often very headstrong, ridiculously competitive, determinated and impulsive, Fujimin is also pretty fond of the school rules and social normatives, getting quite melodramatic and unforgiving at the sole idea of a boy peeking at girls, sneaking into their showers or even hearing girls chatting about boys; hinting at a deep misandry.
